In summary, the overall user profile of 5chan can be summarized as: young people who gather together due to the same interest, have a desire for self-expression, value internal relationships, have exclusionary psychology towards external groups, have stronger cohesion within the forum, and are more active in communication.

2. Functional Features of 5chan

When studying the potential game community of 2ch, it is necessary to not only focus on the user characteristics of the entire 2ch forum, but also combine the functional characteristics of the 2ch forum itself.

Currently, 5chan has 39 main boards, and the main boards are further divided into sub-boards. Among them, there are three main boards related to games, namely games, mobile games, and online games. Under the main board, the platform will make a more detailed classification of games according to the type of game. The game board covers a wider range of games and contains more sub-boards. Users can click on the corresponding sub-board to enter the section after judging according to the type of game they want to browse.

 

After entering a sub-board, you can first see the content and theme discussed in the board. In order to prevent users from going to the wrong board and posting in the wrong place, links to connected or easily confused boards will be marked.

For example, Naraka: Bladepoint belongs to the PC Action (PC action game) section, and the content discussed is all FPS, TPS, and action games running on Windows and other computers. Please go to other sections for other types of games, such as adult-oriented Galgames, online games, etc. Like Baidu Tieba, the board rules and posting rules are located at the top for new users to use.

[Do not reply to any troublemaking, inciting, prohibited topics, hit-and-run, or useless posts >(repliers are also regarded as troublemakers)]

[Please confirm before posting]

  • This is a public place. Please do not create useless posts unrelated to PC action games.
  • Please confirm that you have not posted in the wrong section.
  • Please search the [Post Overview] again to confirm that no one has posted duplicate or similar posts.
  • Series works should be posted in a unified post. Niche games should be based on the manufacturer.

Crimes, illegal copying, software exchange, emulators, pornography, yellow jokes, attacks on fixed nicknames and individual players, and repeaters are prohibited.

 

This ensures that users who enter a certain post are first of all interested in the field where the post is located or have already understood it, and can communicate with people who have the same interest, and the speeches in the communication process follow the same forum rules and themes. Secondly, due to the secrecy of the retrieval system and the anonymity of users, 5chan is distinguished from some popular social media such as Twitter and completely open communication communities such as Discord.

In addition, due to the characteristics of the forum, the content of users’ speeches on 5chan will also be different from other communities. As mentioned above, the exclusionary psychology of 5chan users is reflected in the rules of the forum. They often prohibit new players from directly posting duplicate content without reading previous posts, or posting some content that is not worth posting separately. We believe that the rules that new users first read after entering 5chan will give them a feeling of entering an internal group from the public world, which will make them naturally abide by the rules of the internal group, otherwise they will be expelled by the internal group. The process of browsing the post history is not only a process of learning the rules of the internal group, but also a process of gradually recognizing their identity as an internal member.

In addition to the characteristics of user speeches, when searching for information on social media such as Twitter, it is usually a direct search or following some related tweeters. This will make users browse more than communicate even if they are interested in a certain field on social media. Even if they tweet to ask some content, they may not be answered. The unique Japanese habit of “FF-gai kara shitsurei shimasu” (I’m sorry to comment without following you or being followed by you) will also make the communication lengthy and complicated, and whether or not to follow will get a lot of redundant information that they don’t want. However, in a separate post of a certain game on 5chan, the desire for communication among members who belong to this internal group is greater than their desire for browsing, and the various conveniences of the forum also ensure that members can speak and discuss freely under the constraints of regulations. Therefore, the communication of users on the forum is more prosperous, and the feedback on the game will be directly posted on the forum.

 

3. Naraka: Bladepoint in 5chan

The Naraka: Bladepoint thread in 5chan was created on November 12, 2020 during the game’s internal test, which triggered players’ discussions about the initial hero strength. Since the game had not yet been released, the thread also became inactive. In April 2021, the game was tested again, and because it was possible to directly experience the game, the discussion about the game in the thread was also more active. Players’ discussions during the game test can directly reflect the players’ real views on the game, guiding the development team to further improve the content of the game.

After the game was officially released, the discussion of the game was directly focused on the essence of the game - gameplay. In Japan, the solo mode of Naraka: Bladepoint is classified as a fighting game, and the release method of the character’s ultimate, the strength of the character, and the combos of various weapons have been discussed. For the parts other than the gameplay itself, the battle pass, and the face customization function, which is one of the hot spots of the game, can only be said to be rarely discussed. In addition to the discussion focused on the gameplay itself and the exchange and discussion of game techniques, unlike other communities, this is not a platform for making friends, so there is no pure personal showing off and unprovoked insults to other players, and due to the high degree of participation and cohesion, the questions raised by players can also be answered.

 

Compared with other social media, such as Twitter and Weibo, the visible range of content posted is filtered, requiring keyword searches or following someone, and the lack of anonymity and other functions also leads to users being unlikely to get interaction. Even if they can participate in the discussion in real time, it is difficult to form a discussion atmosphere where many people express their opinions on the same issue. In addition, due to visibility, word count limits, and disagreement with others, negative impressions posted on open large-scale social media may also cause disgust and lead to disputes. In contrast, 5chan first filters the participants in the discussion - players who have a certain understanding of Naraka: Bladepoint. Secondly, the anonymity, functions, and its own cohesive characteristics of the forum make the discussion here more active and real, showing the players’ gaming experience, rather than meaningless complaints, spam, or recruitment information.

4. Conclusion

When understanding overseas game trends through research and capture of game communities, and then feeding back to game development, it is first necessary to understand the composition and characteristics of overseas communities in the target country. On the basis of further understanding user needs, apply them to the improvement of the game. The communities of each country will show different characteristics in their own culture and the evolution of Internet history, which is also a part worth paying attention to. How to use the characteristics reflected in the communities of each country to promote the game is also a topic that needs to be considered when expanding influence through communities.

entry.title: Why Do Players Turn a Blind Eye? Novice Guide Design from the Perspective of Selective Attention
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

In game research, we found a common phenomenon: when players experience new games or new gameplays, they often complain that the game’s guidance is unclear and they don’t understand how to play; on the other hand, the developers feel very confused. There is obviously a long introduction to the gameplay in the game, so why do players feel that the guidance is not enough?

Some veteran players also feel that new players are particularly “blind and unskilled” when they team up with new players to play dungeons. Even if the information is obvious, the novice will say that they did not see it.

So, how does this “blindness” of players come about? Do they really not see it, or do they not want to see it?

1. How Common is “Not Seeing”?

When players are doing novice training, they need to go through the following steps to finally master the gameplay: I see the guide, I know I need to do this, I do it, I learn it. And if any of these steps are missing, it will cause the player to fail to learn.

In the initial research expectation, we believed that players getting stuck in the novice stage might be more difficult in “completing the guide”, that is, the task settings need to be adjusted. However, subsequent eye-tracking tests showed that more players were stuck in the first two steps, that is, the players did not see the guide at all, and this was not because the players were unwilling to read the novice guide. In the test, even if players were required not to skip the guide and to follow the guide prompts, they would still miss a lot of information.

Psychological research also confirms that this “invisibility” of players is not only common, but also innate, and is related to the selective attention mechanism.

2. Why Can’t Players “See”? The Characteristics of Attention Determine That People Only See What They Want to See

If the human brain is a TV set, external information is various TV programs, and attention is the process of selecting TV programs. Only the TV programs that finally appear on the screen can be noticed by us. Although in many cases people can consciously choose which programs to watch, in many cases, this choice is subconscious. Among them, those that do not require will effort and that people can naturally pay attention to are called involuntary attention. For example, it is difficult not to hear the ringing of a mobile phone in a quiet meeting room; a red flower in a green lawn will be more conspicuous than a green flower. The act of paying attention that requires will effort and needs to be actively made is called voluntary attention, such as reviewing homework before an exam, learning some useful but boring new knowledge, etc.

It is theorized that involuntary attention is a subconscious response and does not occupy psychological resources; but voluntary attention requires the player’s resources. Therefore, when receiving multiple external information, due to limited cognitive resources, players will selectively pay attention, that is, only see what they want to see and the most important information, while ignoring other information.

In the game, if the player cannot see the guide, it means that the current guide is likely to occupy too many resources, causing the player to spend too much effort to play the game. If you want the novice of the game to be noticed by the player, you need to manage the player’s attention and try to attract the player’s involuntary attention.

3. What Kind of Information is Easier to be Seen: Information That is Different and Information That Matches Your Interests

So, how to attract the player’s involuntary attention and let the player see it effortlessly? The reasons for attracting involuntary attention can be summarized into two categories:

The characteristics of the information itself are different and differentiated.

For example, it can be something unusual happening suddenly in the game, or it can be a significant difference from the surrounding game scene.

For example, when the game needs to guide the player to perform a dodge operation, there are generally prompts in the form of guide text or screen special effects. If the screen color or brightness changes significantly when the boss releases a skill, for example, a bright red circle appears in the skill range, the player will be able to pay attention to it at once without additional effort; but if there is only a change in the content of the guide text on the screen, the player is likely to not see it. Because the guide task prompts in the game are generally fixed on the left side of the screen, when the guide continues to appear in this state, in the player’s view, this area lacks change and lacks distinction from the surrounding scene, so it will be instinctively ignored.

The information matches the person’s own state, interests, and needs.

In other words, the more the information matches the player’s interests, the more attention it can attract.

For example, when a new player encounters a new type of game for the first time, he will have some questions in his mind and expect a novice tutorial to guide his operation. At this time, the guide that pops up will be more easily noticed; and when a veteran player is playing the game, he has no expectations or related needs for guidance, so he often operates before consciousness and is more likely to not see the relevant guidance in the game.

4. How Can Selective Attention and Involuntary Attention Guide Novice Design?

How can the above characteristics related to attention guide the novice design of the game? Here are just a few interesting examples.

Which form is better for novice guidance?

Common novice guides are presented in text, pictures, and videos. According to our life experience, we will think that words are not as good as pictures, and pictures are not as good as videos. Some studies have also confirmed that paying attention to pictures can improve learning effects more than paying attention to text. But other studies have shown that it is not absolute that pictures are better than text, and the contrast effect needs to be considered.

Contrast Effect 1: Look at words when there are many pictures, and look at pictures when there are many words, highlighting the differences.

When we observe real-world scenes, our attention is always attracted by the text embedded in these scenes, for example, text on signs or billboards. A study of travel photos found that people look more at the text in the pictures, and no matter what the text content is, they will pay attention to the text.

When we conducted eye-tracking tests on Naraka: Bladepoint, we also unexpectedly found that for the text and picture guides presented simultaneously in the game, the player’s gaze duration on the text was significantly longer than that on the pictures. In other words, people are always more likely to pay attention to information that is different. Whether the game chooses text guidance or picture guidance needs to be determined according to the characteristics of the game.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Novice Guide Player Eye-tracking Heat Map

But once the research scene is changed to a text-based webpage, the situation changes. Eye-tracking data shows that the pictures in the text pile are more eye-catching.

 

Eye-tracking heat map for a webpage, the subject’s gaze is concentrated on the picture

Contrast Effect 2: Less is more, the more white space, the easier it is to be seen

When there is too little white space between the logo and the main title, people will spend more time looking at the logo instead of the main title. And when the distance between the logo and the main title is increased, people’s attention to the title will increase. When two buttons are too close, they will also compete for attention. After changing to only one option, people’s visual attention increases.

 

After the spacing is changed, the subject’s attention to the title increases

In games, in order not to compete for attention, you can increase the white space between important prompts and buttons, and at the same time avoid dense presentation of important information in a paragraph of text.

In addition to bombarding the vision, how else can novice guidance guide attention?

For the common problem that players cannot understand the guidance, developers easily want to “write more detailed guidance information” to help players understand. But the contrast effect has pointed out that dense text will cause players’ attention to be scattered, and to highlight the key points, more attention needs to be paid to white space. So, what else can be done?

Multichannel presentation: Visual + auditory multi-sensory presentation

Compared with players who only pay attention to vision or hearing, players who pay attention to both the visual and auditory channels process information faster and more accurately. Auditory information can attract the player’s visual attention to the direction pointed to by the auditory signal, and improve the efficiency of subsequent information processing.

For example, in Ghost of Tsushima, when players are near a Mongolian camp, they may hear singing, drumming, and playing the morin khuur; they may also hear the playing of the pipa, and players can follow the sound to find the storyteller, thus being led to new tasks. Foxes are another example. Their short, sharp calls manage the player’s attention early on, making it difficult for the player to miss the guidance and ultimately leading the player to the shrine.

 

Line guidance: Any form of cue can guide the player to focus on the key points faster

Proximity effect: The closer the picture and text, the better the learning

The position of pictures and text will also affect people’s attention to learning materials. The closer the pictures and text, the longer the gaze duration, the more gaze times, and the better the memory of the knowledge points afterwards; and when the pictures and text are close, people’s gaze point switching between the pictures and text is more frequent. This means that the proximity effect affects people’s attention allocation, thereby improving the learning effect.

 

“The formation principle of lightning” as learning material, the right picture is the picture-text proximity group, the learning effect is better

People’s eyes tend to follow arrows, and hand-drawn arrow prompts can be used to highlight key points

Designers always want to use visual cues to try to guide users’ browsing direction on a webpage, so are some visual cues more effective than others? Some studies have tried different forms such as hand-drawn arrows, character photos (looking at the table & facing away from the table), line prompts, and adding border outlines. The final result shows that visual cues do affect users’ attention to the form, with hand-drawn arrows leading to the most user attention to the form.

 

5. Summary

The player’s turning a blind eye is more related to the selective attention mechanism, and the characteristics of attention determine that people will only see what they want to see. Game design should pay attention to the player’s attention management, try to attract the player’s involuntary attention, rather than forcing indoctrination. For example, you can consider making the information more different and making the information more in line with the player’s current interests. Specifically in the design, the contrast effect, proximity effect, multichannel presentation, line guidance, etc. can all be used as design guidelines.

entry.title: ChatGPT Evaluation Is It a Good Translation Tool
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

In recent years, artificial intelligence technology has made continuous progress, and its application scenarios have continued to expand and deepen. AIGC, or AI-generated content, has broken through the public’s cognitive and imaginative boundaries of AI technology. With its outstanding capabilities in content creation such as voice, text, images, videos, and others, it may pose a huge challenge to a large number of practitioners in various industries, such as artists, engineers, and designers, and the era of change it triggers is obvious.

ChatGPT (Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer) is a natural language processing tool driven by artificial intelligence technology, a specific application and product of AIGC. It can understand and learn human language to conduct conversations, interact based on the context of the chat, really chat and communicate like humans, and even complete tasks such as writing emails, video scripts, copywriting, translation, code, and writing papers.

For the gaming industry, possible application scenarios of AIGC include: AI drawing, AI dubbing, copywriting planning, faster collection of materials and information, operations can use templates for writing, and programmers can use it to write and debug computer programs.

So, for localization services, can ChatGPT’s translation function be implemented in practical application scenarios? This article will select Naraka: Bladepoint translated text of different styles, use the translation results of human translators as the standard, and use BLEU scoring and manual evaluation to compare the translation results of Deepl and ChatGPT, two machine translation tools, in order to obtain a preliminary conclusion.

1. Test Preparation

First, we made a series of preparations before the test, and determined the selection of tools, data, standards, and other dimensions.

  • ChatGPT version: 3.5

  • Evaluation data: 4 sets of representative texts were selected from the Naraka: Bladepoint translation library as evaluation data

  • Machine translation tool: Deepl

    The reason for choosing Deepl is that it performs relatively more accurately in terms of translation quality, especially in the translation of words and phrases. Relatively speaking, Google Translate is suitable for general translation tasks, such as daily expressions, simple business communication, etc., but the translation quality is relatively average. Deepl is suitable for more professional translation tasks, such as translating technical documents, academic papers, etc., or occasions that require higher translation quality.

  • Test languages: Chinese, English, Spanish

  • Evaluation standard: BLEU score

    BLEU (Bilingual Evaluation Understudy) is used to evaluate the correspondence between machine translation and professional human translation. The core idea is that the closer the machine translation is to professional human translation, the better the quality. BLEU is the oldest, most commonly used, and most classic indicator in the field of machine translation. Most machine translation papers even use only this one indicator as the evaluation standard of the system, and its importance is obvious.

    Although BLEU scoring is a widely used automatic evaluation method, it also has some shortcomings: it cannot consider semantic and contextual information, it is sensitive to the number of standard reference texts, it can only be based on n-gram matching, and it cannot handle rare words. Therefore, it needs to be combined with other evaluation methods for comprehensive evaluation to accurately assess translation quality.

2. Test Method

This article selects four different types of existing translations of Naraka: Bladepoint, including skill descriptions, background stories, action descriptions, and literary classical style. In order to compare the translation effects of Deepl and ChatGPT, we use them to perform “Chinese-English”, “Chinese-Spanish”, and “English-Spanish” operations respectively. At the same time, we use the translation results of human translators as the standard and use BLEU to score the above translations. By comparing the BLEU scores of various translations, we can evaluate the performance of Deepl and ChatGPT in terms of translation quality and provide a basis for subsequent analysis.

3. Test Results and Analysis

Machine Evaluation

First, we use the BLEU score to initially compare the performance of Deepl and ChatGPT.

Source Text Target Text Deepl ChatGPT
Chinese English 46.8 28.5
Chinese English 13.5 9.7
Chinese English 27.2 30.7
Chinese English 20.2 19.3
Chinese Spanish 23.0 27.0
Chinese Spanish 19.6 17.9
Chinese Spanish 23.3 19.8
Chinese Spanish 23.6 19.4
English Spanish 38.4 41.4
English Spanish 38.6 38.4
English Spanish 29.0 27.9
English Spanish 34.0 28.1

  • Similarity to Human Translation

    In terms of absolute score, the BLEU score can indicate the quality of machine translation. The higher the score, the higher the degree of matching between the machine translation result and the reference translation, and the better the quality of the machine translation. Generally speaking, a score higher than 40 can be considered a good machine translation result. In our evaluation results, only one score of Deepl and ChatGPT each exceeded 40. This shows that at this stage, the similarity between machine translation results and human translation results is low, and the practical effect is not good.

    In terms of relative score, among the 12 BLEU scores, only 5 scores of ChatGPT are higher than Deepl, which shows that the similarity between ChatGPT translation and human translation is lower than that of Deepl.

    In order to verify the reliability of this result, we checked the test results of other scholars. The BLEU evaluation results for 50 sentences showed that the average scores of Deepl and ChatGPT for Chinese-English translation were lower than 40, and the similarity between ChatGPT translation and human translation was lower than that of Deepl.

  • English to Spanish is Better Than Chinese to Spanish

    From a vertical perspective, whether it is Deepl or ChatGPT, the scores of English-Spanish are higher than those of Chinese-Spanish. There are two main reasons for this:

    1. Because of the size of the corpus, the translations of Deepl and ChatGPT are based on their respective Internet corpora, and it is obvious that the corpus of English-Spanish is richer than that of Chinese-Spanish. It is estimated that the number of English-Spanish corpora currently used for machine translation has reached millions to tens of millions; while the number of corpora translated from Chinese to Spanish is only tens of thousands to hundreds of thousands.
    2. Because of language similarity, Chinese and Spanish have low similarity. Chinese belongs to the Sino-Tibetan language family, and Spanish belongs to the Romance language family, with great differences in grammar and vocabulary; although English belongs to the Germanic language family and Spanish belongs to the Romance language family, both belong to the Indo-European language family, and there are many similarities in grammar and vocabulary; at the same time, compared with Asian culture, the cultural background differences between English and Spanish, which are both in the Western world, are small.

Human Analysis

  • Grammar

    With a huge Internet corpus and clever grammar rule settings, the grammar of machine translation is almost always compliant. When translating long sentences, machine translation can skillfully use various adverbs and clauses to completely express the original text, presenting a good translation result.

    However, there are some subtle deficiencies when subjective judgment is required. For example, in the English-Spanish translation of hero skills, English omits the subject of the whole paragraph when translating hero skills. When human translators deal with it, considering that it describes hero skills, they use the hero as the subject, while Deepl uses the player as the subject, and ChatGPT directly processes it into a sentence without a subject. In contrast, human translators are better when subjective judgment is required.

  • Wording

    The performance of machine translation in terms of wording is average. For simple action descriptions and storytelling, machine translation can do the job. However, once it encounters words that need to be deeply understood, such as game terminology, idioms, cultural backgrounds, and mythological allusions, machine translation will face huge challenges and often fail to translate accurately, and may even make serious mistakes. This is because these words have complex meanings and cultural backgrounds, and need to be understood in conjunction with context and context, and machine translation is currently difficult to achieve complete human understanding.

    • Game terminology

      “单双排” (dān shuāng pái) is a basic game term used to describe the mode in which players participate in the game. Human translators correctly translated it as “Solo and Duos”.

      However, the machine translation performance was poor, and they were all processed as “single and double rows” (Deepl) and “single and double formations” (ChatGPT). This shows that there are still defects in machine translation in identifying and understanding game terminology.

    • Idioms and sayings

      “老当益壮” (lǎo dāng yì zhuàng) means that one is old, but his physical strength and spirit are stronger. The human translator did not translate it literally, but adopted the method of free translation, “move with the energy of a man half your age”.

      Deepl’s processing is very direct, “old and strong”, simple and crude; ChatGPT is relatively smarter, “is aging like wine”, which means “get better over time”. Although it has been interpreted, it is not completely consistent with the meaning of praising physical strength and spirit. Moreover, it is not appropriate to use it in the context of “Shen Miao praising grandpa for being old and strong”.

    • Mythological allusions

      “鱼化龙” (yú huà lóng) is an ancient Chinese legend that tells the story of an ordinary carp that finally succeeded in becoming a dragon through continuous efforts. Chinese players understand this word with almost no cultural barriers, but Western players basically do not have this cultural background. Therefore, in order to better convey the connotation of the allusion, the human translator translated it on the basis of a simple explanation, “Like the ancient fish of legend, growing legs and rising to become dragons”.

      However, the machine translation simply translated it according to the literal meaning, “transform from a fish to a dragon” (Deepl), “rise like a dragon from a fish” (ChatGPT).

    • Cultural background

      “神机营” (shén jī yíng) was one of the three major battalions of the capital’s forbidden army in the Ming Dynasty. It was a special force in the Ming Dynasty army that specialized in managing firearms. Therefore, when the human translator dealt with it, it was translated as “Firearms Division”.

      Deepl translated it as “Divine Machine Camp”, and ChatGPT translated it as “Divine Machine Corps”. I wonder what foreign players think when they see the magical machine.

  • Literariness

    When describing Ning Hongye’s bundled Pear Garden White Element, the planner quoted the Yue opera “The Legend of the White Snake” lyrics: “冲出峨嵋万重山，踏破云层往人间” (chōng chū é méi wàn chóng shān, tà pò yún céng wǎng rén jiān). It is Bai Suzhen’s monologue after she transformed into a human and walked out of Mount Emei. The main meaning of this lyric is that the white snake breaks through the barriers of the many peaks of Emei, treads through the clouds, and comes to the human world from the sky. This expresses that the white snake does not hesitate to venture out of the mountain to stay with Xu Xian, overcomes many obstacles, transforms into a human form and comes to the human world.

    The translator’s translation is: “Lo, she bursts forth from the myriad peaks of Emei, Clouds treaded underfoot, down from heavens high in the sky.” The wording is gorgeous and poetic. “Lo” is used to express surprise or attention, and is more common in literary works or religious texts. “Bursts forth” is used to describe breaking through, which means breaking through obstacles and breaking through constraints, which is more vivid. “Myriad peaks” expresses the meaning of numerous and countless peaks, which is more gorgeous. “Clouds treaded underfoot” refers to stepping on clouds, which has a magical and romantic mood. “Down from heavens high in the sky” expresses the mysterious feeling of falling from the sky and being high above, which is more poetic.

    Deepl’s translation is “Break out of Emei’s ten thousand mountains and step through the clouds to earth.” ChatGPT’s translation is “Breaking through the Emei Mountains, stepping through the clouds towards the mortal realm.” Although they can express the meaning of the original text, they use relatively straightforward expressions, lacking beauty and mysticism. Among them, “Break out of” and “Breaking through” are directly translated as “冲出” (chōng chū), lacking the details and beauty of the action; “万重山” (wàn chóng shān) is literally translated as “ten thousand mountains” by Deepl, while ChatGPT ignores the adjective “万重” (wàn chóng), thus losing the description of the towering mountains in the original text; “to earth” and “towards the mortal realm” Although it expresses the meaning of “往人间” (wǎng rén jiān), it lacks a certain sense of mysticism, making it impossible for readers to feel the emotions in the original text.

4. Conclusion

It will take time for machine translation to dominate.

At this stage, machine translations represented by Deepl and ChatGPT perform well in terms of grammar, but perform poorly when it comes to understanding game terminology, idioms, cultural backgrounds, and mythological allusions, or when literary interpretation is required.

Overall, the machine translation results are quite different from the human translation results. In practice, translators need to make major adjustments to the machine translation results to meet the requirements; the ideal working mode at present is still human-based and machine-assisted.

Using cooking as an analogy, the current level of machine translation is equivalent to preparing and matching some raw materials, waiting for the chef to cook, to make delicious dishes. The chef’s level has a greater impact on the final result.

Compared with machine translation tools such as Deepl, ChatGPT, as a model that can be continuously iterated and learned, may reach the level of fast food in the future, which can be eaten by simply heating, and has almost no requirements for human cooking skills. But as for how it tastes, it still needs time to test. But it is foreseeable that ChatGPT has a promising future!

entry.title: What Are the Game Preferences and Choices of Rigorous and Conservative German Players
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

1. Overview of the German Game Market

Germany is located in central Europe. It is the engine of Europe and also the largest economy in Europe and the fourth largest in the world. Data shows that Germany’s total GDP in 2022 was 27.38 trillion.

After setting a revenue record in 2020, the German game market also achieved explosive growth in 2021, with a total revenue (including hardware, games, subscriptions, and in-game purchases) of approximately 9.76 billion euros. Compared with 2012, it has more than tripled.

 

As of 2021, German game market revenue (published on February 23, 2023)

The growing demand of German players for game-related hardware (especially consoles) is considered to be an important driving force for the booming German game market. Although some game consoles were in short supply due to the impact of the epidemic on the supply chain and logistics, the overall revenue of consoles also resisted the pressure and increased by 23%, reaching 808 million euros. Revenue from in-app purchases has also increased.

 

German hardware revenue achieved huge growth in 2021

It is worth noting that, in addition to areas strongly related to games, such as game copies and hardware, which have performed well, the market for game furniture and game accessories in Germany is also gradually taking the stage. According to a survey by the German Game Industry Association, nearly millions of players have purchased game-related furniture, and more than 11 million players plan to purchase game-related furniture, including gaming chairs, computer stands, controller stands, lamps, etc. Therefore, many well-known furniture manufacturers in Germany have also launched their game series furniture in order to occupy this huge market early.

 

From a platform perspective, according to statistics from the German Game Association, as of 2022, there are 23.5 million mobile game players in Germany. In addition, there are 10.7 million users who use tablets to play games. The number of mobile game users accounts for a relatively high proportion.

The demand of German players for consoles (such as Switch, PlayStation, Xbox) is also basically increasing year by year. It may be that the impact of the epidemic is getting smaller and smaller, and most Germans are no longer locked down at home, so the number of PC players has decreased slightly in comparison.

 

2. The Consequences of an Aging Population: An Aging Player Base

According to the latest population statistics in 2022, Germany has a total population of 82.196 million. Its game penetration rate is nearly 60%, which means that 6 out of every 10 people have gaming experience, and the number of game players is approaching 50 million.

At the same time, the quality of German game users is also very high. Most German players believe that payment is a guarantee of game quality, and their willingness to pay is second only to the United States. Nearly 70% of players are willing to pay for games.

 

(Note: The data comes from a questionnaire survey conducted by Gamma Data (CNG) on mobile game user groups in the United States/Germany/France/United Kingdom.)

On the other hand, according to data from the German Federal Statistical Office, except for the elderly group over 75 years old, the largest age group in Germany is 55-59 years old, accounting for 8.2% of the total population. The average age of the German population has reached 47 years old.

 

The serious aging of the population has also increased the average age of game players. According to survey data from market research company GfK: The proportion of middle-aged and elderly players in Germany aged 50-59 reached 18%, which is the highest proportion of age groups. Many players in the 1980s and 1990s have maintained their hobby of playing video games to this day. At the same time, the average age of German game players is also increasing year by year: in 2020, the average age of players was 37.4 years old, and in 2021, it has reached 37.6 years old.

 

Germany has a general trend of an aging society, so German residents are rigorous, relatively conservative, pay attention to order, and are less social. Nearly 80% of players will learn about product user reviews, overall ratings, and descriptions before downloading the game. At the same time, the relatively conservative characteristics are also subtly affecting the aesthetics of Germans. For example, Germans tend to wear darker clothes, and like to wear practical clothes such as jackets. At the same time, they are also conservative in the aesthetic style of games, and do not like overly chaotic and bright colors.

For example, in the evaluation of the appearance of female characters in Naraka: Bladepoint, some German players gave positive comments because some female characters did not wear high heels, which is very practical in actual combat.

Therefore, grasping the above characteristics of German players can help game manufacturers to be more successful when going overseas to Germany. At the same time, these characteristics are also reflected in German players’ preferences for games.

3. German Players’ Game Preferences and Choices

Rigorous and conservative Germans maintain their consistent habits in the choice of game genres: strategy games are especially popular. Surveys show that the 5 most popular game categories in Germany in 2022 are: strategy, action, action-adventure, adventure, and simulation.

 

According to data from Data.ai, among the games with the most downloads by German players, strategy games + match-3 games account for 70% of the list. The Top 10 of the list are basically casual puzzle games, which is also in line with the needs of middle-aged and elderly players for game choices: they don’t need to spend too much time, the gameplay is not particularly intense, and they can sit quietly on the sofa and use their brains.

 

The loyalty of the German mobile game market is very high, which is not only reflected in the choice of games: Coin Master, which ranks first in mobile game revenue, was released 13 years ago, but it still occupies the top few positions in the German game list for many years. Classic match-3 games like Candy Crush Saga have also been released for 9 years. Most of the games on the list are old games that have been released for more than two years. It can be seen that Germans are very dedicated to their favorite games.

In addition, their choice of game genres is also very single, fixed on strategy, elimination, and simulation management.

 

The rankings of PC and console games are very different from those of mobile games. In addition to the simulation management games that German players love, most of the PC games on the list are relatively hardcore. EA Sports FIFA 22, which was just released by EA, once again topped the sales chart, which shows the German players’ love for football. It is followed by the open-world game Grand Theft Auto V launched by Rockstar. The third place is the racing game Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. The fourth place is Farming Simulator 22, and the fifth place is Minecraft. Most of the games on the list can meet the needs of teaming up or have pvp modes, which can meet some competitive needs of hardcore PC players.

 

4. Summary

The game culture in Germany is very mature, and many players have been exposed to games since childhood. In addition, German players have a high willingness to pay. Due to the aging of the population, the average age of players has increased, which is also the reason why German players have relatively strong payment capabilities. As the engine of the European economy, Germany also has one of the largest game markets in Europe, with almost 60% of Germans having gaming experience.

Unlike Chinese players, console games still maintain a high status in Germany, but the development of mobile games has surpassed traditional games, and more than 70% of players play mobile games.

In addition, German players have obvious “nostalgic” characteristics. Most of the various rankings are old games that have been online for more than 2 years, and the genres are relatively single. This also brings a lot of pressure to some new products that want to enter the German market. But on the other hand, when you want to enter the German market, the selection of products is more accurate. Once a new product is accepted by players, it is easier to stabilize and settle down.

entry.title: How to Leverage the Positive Effects of Geographic Location Information in Game Design
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

With the development of mobile information technology, the technology of obtaining users’ geographical coordinates through signals has been widely used in all aspects of our lives. Naturally, geographic location information has also been widely used in games.

When it comes to game design based on geographic location information, the first thing that comes to mind is probably Pokémon GO. The gameplay of this game is based on augmented reality (AR) technology. Players need to collect, battle, and train Pokémon in the real world. In addition, based on LBS (Location Based Services) technology, players can deeply integrate the real map with the game screen and explore in the real world.

 

But in fact, in addition to being embedded in the gameplay, geographic location information also plays a positive role in the design of other game systems. This article will start from the system functions and briefly discuss the application of geographic location information in the design of game system functions and the positive effects it brings.

1. Using Players’ Geographic Information as a Dimension of Leaderboards to Motivate Players to Pursue Achievements

In some games with high DAU, it is very difficult for individual players to get on the global leaderboard. For those players who do not have the strength to get on the global leaderboard, but have a high demand for achievement goals, sub-leaderboards can meet their needs for a sense of achievement. The more detailed the leaderboard, the more achievement goal directions players can pursue – “With so many leaderboards, I can always excel in one..

 

In addition to in-game attributes, many games now introduce the concept of players’ provinces and cities in reality, and divide player groups based on players’ geographic information, so that players in the same group are in a large leaderboard. It is common in some games with strong confrontation. For example, in Onmyoji Arena, which everyone is familiar with, the game ranks players of each Shikigami in their province and city. The ranking reflects the level of players playing a certain hero.

 

Such a regionally-subdivided ranking, first of all, will give everyone a more concrete concept of the strength represented by this ranking. Players may have a vague perception of how many people are playing a game in the country, but their cognition of how many people are playing around them is clearer. For example, “Shanghai’s No. 1 Yoto Hime”, friends in Shanghai will have a relatively concrete feeling of the weight of this “No. 1”.

Secondly, the relevance of ranking in the same region is also more likely to become a topic of conversation among friends. Friends who can get together in reality have similar life trajectories, and most of them live in nearby areas, so they have a stronger sense of the fun of regional ranking topics. Others’ feedback on your ranking will also motivate you to pursue the ranking. For example, we are going to have a five-player game in a party. I don’t know many heroes and I quickly choose Oitsuki. My friend says, “I’ll take the mid lane, you just lie down and win. Let me, Hangzhou’s No. 8 Higanbana, carry you.” It’s not that I really care about my friend’s skills, but this kind of talk makes people feel “Oh, that’s interesting”, and the feedback from everyone increases Higanbana’s pride in this ranking.

This kind of ranking based on geographic location grouping is not limited to the form of a leaderboard. There are also common regional online events. Players in the same region are used as a group for internal competition, and the winning players will get corresponding achievements in the game. Although it is not in the form of a leaderboard, it can also motivate players to pursue their achievement goals. For example, the China Online Tour in UNO!.

 

2. Divide Groups Based on Players’ Geographic Information to Increase Motivation for Competition

In addition to ranking within the group, ranking with geographic location as a natural group link and group as a unit will also motivate players’ game behavior. For example, in Yang Le Ge Yang, which went viral on the Internet at the end of 2022, for this game with a very low clearance rate, on the one hand, players all hope to be the lucky one to clear the level with a small probability. On the other hand, the reason why many players keep playing tirelessly may be to help their province’s sheep team to be on the top sheep list of the day. The extremely low clearance rate and the setting of ranking by region as a group greatly stimulate players’ desire for challenge and sense of collective honor.

 

In Yang Le Ge Yang, regional ranking is more of a group achievement, and the individual’s sense of achievement is not so strong. At first glance, you may wonder why this regional ranking can also motivate players. This involves the relationship between individual interests and group interests. Group members will unite against outsiders, and individuals belonging to the group will hope that the group will develop better. It is a behavioral preference rooted in the human genes. The formation of this preference is related to the development of human ethnic groups, which has always been in groups.

First of all, people living in the same area often have a sense of belonging and identity, believing that they are a part of this place, so they have the responsibility and obligation to contribute to this place, so as to maintain and enhance the interests of their community or region. In addition, our traditional culture emphasizes the relationship between individuals and society relatively more, advocating that individuals contribute to society. Under the influence of this culture, players may have a stronger sense of responsibility and obligation to their location. And some regions are relatively strong in culture or economy, which may enhance the pride of local people in their regional identity, thereby enhancing their motivation to “help the sheep team of their province to be on the top sheep list of the day.”

3. Use Real Coordinate Information to Enhance Players’ Social Motivation and Experience

The most basic use of geographic location information in games is that in the player’s personal information, the player can choose to display their city coordinates. With coordinate information, when other players view your profile, if your cities are geographically close, or even in the same city, you can quickly identify it. For example, in MMO games, players often have an in-game personal information display page, where players can display their city coordinates. Of course, players can also choose not to display them.

 

Some games apply the distance information between the two parties in more detail. For example, in Onmyoji, players can see the distance between the speaker and their real coordinates in the chat channel. Even the game chat channel directly opens “Nearby”, which is convenient for players to directly find and interact with nearby like-minded people.

 

In addition to individuals, the game also adds the dimension of geographic location information to group interaction. Players can use the geographic location service (LBS) function to associate their location information with the Onmyoji guild. First of all, the game requires choosing a real coordinate to create a guild. Players can use the LBS function to search for nearby guilds in the real world and join them. Based on such functional logic, most of the players in the same guild are near the guild coordinates.

 

The game will design such a geographic location service in social functions, which actually hits the preference that players always prefer people who are geographically closer in social interactions with strangers. This preference exists even if players do not consider meeting in person or transforming these online social interactions into offline ones.

The psychological distance theory believes that, taking the direct experience of the results of this time, this place, certainty, and oneself as the origin, any indirect experience in any dimension is psychologically distant. Things are scattered in the psychological space according to different dimensions, forming different types of psychological distance. Psychological distance includes four dimensions: time distance, space distance, social distance, and probability distance.

Players usually use various attributes as a measure of the social distance between themselves and other players, such as similar interests and hobbies (same hobby group) and similar strength levels (game combat power or rank). Similar spatial distance is also a natural attribute that quickly shortens the social distance between players, which means that the closer the players are in geographical distance, the higher their initial closeness to each other.

 

And in the process of interaction, the advantages brought by geographic location are not only at the beginning. Friends who are geographically close can continue to receive more attention from players. In-group favoritism is a pattern of cognitive behavior, which means that individuals form an identity with people in the group, and therefore give more positive evaluations, allocate more resources, while giving more negative evaluations or allocating fewer resources to people outside the group. The proximity of geographic location is a kind of in-group division mark. This kind of in-group preference based on geographic area can encourage these players to communicate and support each other more, such as the phenomenon of people in the same area forming groups.

 

Players will prefer people who are geographically closer, which may be influenced by past social experience in addition to natural human cognitive preferences - they find that people from similar regions are more talkative and get along better. Playing games with people who are close to the geographic area, due to similarities in living background, language, cultural customs, and daily travel trajectories, it is easier to establish a common experience and common identity, thereby enhancing the sense of belonging and emotional connection.

Furthermore, for players who have a need gap in real-world social interaction, although they are socializing in the online world, they essentially still hope to establish relatively stable social relationships. Scholar Sherry Turkle (2005) calls the identity in the virtual online world “mud” - it has fluidity, can play with and shape its own form at will, and play different roles.

In the world of online games, the identity of strangers is difficult to distinguish between true and false, and the truth seems to be unimportant. Because strangers lack the fulcrum of real connection, they are like duckweed that blows away. Real connection means the relative authenticity of identity, reducing the sense of haziness and ambiguity in the process of interaction. Therefore, if the online relationship is to develop further, it must provide some kind of certainty and build a trust mechanism. Players who are geographically close are more likely to have some offline contact, such as offline gatherings, group games, etc. The “face-to-face” meeting link can reduce the uncertainty of online identity.

 

The social penetration theory believes that the degree of self-disclosure between the two parties is the core of relationship development. The more offline contact, the more real life players present to each other. While increasing mutual trust, they will also show more aspects of real self-exposure in reality. Players have more bonds with each other, promoting the transformation of weak social ties into strong ties, and are more likely to settle into stable social relationships.

4. Conclusion

The application of geographic location information can play a certain role in motivating players’ social interaction, sense of achievement, etc. When conducting game design, we can better utilize these aspects to bring beneficial effects to the game.

  1. Using players’ geographic information as a dimension of leaderboards to motivate players to pursue achievements:

    • The difficulty of getting on the global leaderboard is greater. The more diversified the leaderboard, the more leaderboard achievement-seeking players can be covered.
    • Regional leaderboards will give everyone a more concrete concept of the strength represented by this ranking.
    • The relevance of ranking in the same region is also more likely to become a topic of conversation among friends. Others’ feedback on your ranking will also motivate players to pursue the ranking.

  2. Divide groups based on players’ geographic information to increase motivation for competition:
    People living in the same area often have a sense of belonging and identity, believing that they are a part of this place and want to maintain and enhance the interests of their community or region. Our traditional culture emphasizes the relationship between individuals and society relatively more, and Chinese players have a stronger sense of pursuit of group ranking goals.

  3. Use real coordinate information to enhance players’ social motivation and experience:

    • The closer the players are in geographical distance, the higher their initial closeness to each other.
    • Friends who are geographically close can continue to receive more attention from players during the interaction.
    • Players who are geographically close are more likely to have some offline contact, which can reduce the uncertainty of online identity. Offline interaction will also show more aspects of real self-exposure in reality, promoting the transformation of weak social ties into strong ties.

entry.title: The Pseudoscience of Color Psychology, Yet Widely Used in Games
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

In the past, many people believed that colors had some kind of mysterious power. Modern psychologists also believe that colors are related to the human brain and have a profound impact on human emotions and behavior. Data shows that when people observe objects, the first 20 seconds are basically spent on the appearance, of which the perception of color accounts for 85%, and the perception of shape accounts for 15%; after two minutes, the color drops to 75%, and after 5 minutes, it tends to be half and half.

The impression color gives to people is rapid, profound, and lasting, which also determines what the first impression of many things is. This article will combine color knowledge and the practical application of color in game design to reveal the answer one by one. Is color psychology really pseudoscience?

1. Using Color to Convey Concepts

Physical Characteristics

On the basis of the same elements or shapes, using different color schemes will present different themes. The well-known art concept designer OLDFISH also emphasized the importance of physical characteristics presented through colors for concept communication. At the same time, colors will also produce differences in material communication. The same shape can be expressed as silver, gold and other materials by giving different inherent colors and light and shadow relationships.

Cultural Characteristics

Some specific colors can express certain cultural characteristics. When people habitually give a specific meaning to a certain group of colors and continue to use them, over time, they will become the symbolic color of this thing, most commonly seen in religion, aristocratic culture, ancient class systems, and customs.

The same color may represent different or even completely opposite meanings in different cultural backgrounds. These cultural connotations related to color will also be reflected in the design of some games. For example, in Chinese culture, red often represents festivity and good luck, while in some Western contexts it sometimes symbolizes violence, blood, and tension. Therefore, in many game scenes with an oriental background, redwood buildings or red decorations often appear, while game scenes with a Western background are relatively rare, mainly using original wood colors, gray, beige, etc. as the main color scheme of residential buildings. Of course, scene design is largely related to the era in which the game background/worldview is located and the theme of the game itself, but as an important element in different cultures, color can also inspire many different design ideas for artists.

Emotional Characteristics

The influence of color on people’s emotions is subtle, and the psychological implications of different colors are also different. To give some common examples in life, the color scheme of many fast food restaurants is red and yellow, giving people a fast-paced psychological suggestion; while hospital rooms are usually decorated in white, light blue and other light colors, which can give people a sense of stability and comfort, which is conducive to soothing emotions.

In the process of game design, color is also a direct and powerful way to evoke players’ emotions. Research on some players by an organization shows that yellow usually means “fun” in the hearts of players, while red usually means “anger”. Of course, these studies are not absolute, but can represent a certain color design trend, which is inseparable from the player’s psychological state. But it is undeniable that the use of different colors can indeed evoke certain specific emotions in people’s hearts.

2. Contrasting Color Matching

According to the strength of the contrast of color attributes, color matching can be roughly divided into complementary colors, contrasting colors, and medium-difference colors. The stronger the contrast of color matching, the higher the recognition between colors. Many game artists use this principle to design scenes, character costumes, etc., which makes it easier to cut the picture and make the strong and weak distinct.

Complementary Colors

Usually, we define colors with an angle of 180° on the color wheel as complementary colors, which is commonly known as “contrasting colors”. Complementary colors have the largest range of hue changes, and the resulting picture color contrast is also the strongest, thus giving people a strong visual impact. But in art design, this also means “high risk”. Too strong a contrast can easily cause disharmony and overstimulation, and it is likely to “step on thunder”.

However, as long as it is properly grasped, “high risk will also bring high returns”, resulting in unexpected aesthetic innovation. Usually, complementary colors have extremely strong contrast and conflict. Therefore, the use of complementary color matching is generally more challenging. Usually, the method of changing the area ratio or saturation is used to present a better visual effect.

Blue and orange, yellow and purple are common complementary color combinations. In the game Naraka: Bladepoint, the costumes of the hero Kurumi have always been the focus of players’ attention. The blue and orange complementary colors used on the chest, sleeves, and waist seal of the Chengyun Lanshou (承云兰寿) have a finishing touch effect, and at the same time set off the lively and clever character image; Huiye Shaonu (辉烨少女) uses a large area of yellow and purple. Although it is also said to be beautiful by many players, it is not as outstanding as the former in terms of color contrast and complementary effect.

Emphasis Color Matching

We mentioned that the three elements of color are hue (i.e., tone), lightness, and chroma (i.e., saturation). In addition to choosing different hue combinations, you can also adjust the lightness and chroma of colors to further emphasize the color relationship.

Especially when the lightness or saturation of a large area of color blocks is low, the color purity of a small area of modules is high, which will naturally present a very advanced sense of contrast. In a low-purity background, especially when black, white, and gray are used as the background color, a small part of high-purity color will be particularly eye-catching.

For example, the group of single-character posters of Naraka: Bladepoint in the picture below has a black and gray overall background. The most eye-catching thing in the picture is the iconic symbolic items of each character, all of which are high-purity red, which directly and implicitly expresses the positioning and even related background of the character, such as the red Buddhist beads on Tsuchimikado’s wrist, the blindfold taken off by Viper Ning, and the red umbrella behind Kurumi. The art form fully reflects the implicitness of oriental narrative, creating a sense of mystery, and the visual performance is also very beautiful.

3. The Role of Color Matching

In addition to the intuitive visual performance that can be seen at a glance, color also has a strong psychological suggestion effect. In game design, it is also common to adjust colors to shape the appearance.

Color Expressiveness and Appearance Quality

By adjusting the hue combination, lightness, and chroma, objects with the same shape can present different effects. Generally speaking, the greater the color change, or the richer the level of change, the final expression of the appearance is also very different. This difference can be cleverly transformed into “rules” of different qualities in game design.

For example, the four pictures below are four costumes of the female character Justina Gu in the game Naraka: Bladepoint. From left to right, the quality and value in the game increase. We can see that in terms of overall color matching, these four sets of clothes are generally relatively close, all of which are white with a reddish-brown color scheme. The default skin on the far left uses red with light brown. The color change is small and soft, and the contrast is not very strong. The expressiveness is also the weakest, corresponding to the initial quality skin in the game that can be obtained for free. Compared with the first set, the second set has no difference in shape design. The only change is that the color of the neckline and skirt is changed to jujube red, and the contrast is stronger, and the quality is also improved by one level. In addition to the more complicated shape design, the combination of white, water red and golden brown in the third set also enhances the sense of color layering. The last set is a very popular Dragon Gate - Apsaras (龙门·飞天) collaboration skin. On the whole, its background color is also white, but the bright red streamer + full body gold embellishment gives this set of costumes a sense of dignity and refinement.

If you further observe these four sets of clothes, the quality increases from left to right. The lightness of the red color scheme of the second to fourth sets also has different “standards”. The relatively low-quality ones mostly use colors with low lightness, and the highest-quality ones use bright red with high lightness and chroma, and the material presents a golden luster.

Color Shapes Spatial Relationships

In reality, the presentation of colors will be affected by factors such as light and distance. For example, if there is extra lighting when taking portraits, the skin will appear whiter and more translucent. For example, when trying on clothes in a mall, there are often small spotlights in front of the dressing mirror, which is also to make the color of the clothes appear the most eye-catching effect.

In the game, the designer will use this feature in reverse, using the light and dark changes of colors to shape the spatial relationship of the scene. For example, in the scene in the picture, the rockery, stones, and trees on the right have higher color purity and are visually closer; the houses and trees in the distance have lower purity but higher brightness, and the color contrast is blurred, giving people a feeling of being illuminated by sunlight in the distance.

4. Summary

The above is a preliminary exploration of the use of color in game design. In many scenes where users are usually contacted, whenever a player is asked “Why do you like this game?”, many people will say without thinking that they are attracted by the exquisite graphics or unique art style of the game. Vision is the first impression many players have of a game, and then gradually goes deep into gameplay, genre, social interaction and other factors. Color plays a vital role in the “first impression”. By making good use of color matching, the design philosophy of game art can be better conveyed, and the success of commercialization can also be better assisted.

entry.title: Designing for the Real World Game Accessibility Features (Auditory)
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

For sighted people, even with the golden key of accessibility services, after actual operation, it is found that there are quite a few hurdles to overcome. It is even more difficult to imagine how blind people can happily play mobile games with us. Everyone jokes that poverty limits their imagination, but after seeing a set of real data, I found that my imagination is actually limited by prejudice.

According to the “Basic Situation Report of Visually Impaired Internet Users in China” released by the Secretariat of the China Information Accessibility Product Alliance (CAPA), there are 13 million visually impaired people in China (as of 2016), of which 91% are blind people of level one and two (as shown in the figure below).

 

Disability Level Ratio of 13 Million Visually Impaired People

Among the visually impaired users surveyed, 92% use smartphones, of which 22% have used Internet software such as Didi, Kuaidi, and Uber to hail taxis, 33% have installed 11-20 applications on their mobile phones, and 83% can completely rely on screen reading functions when operating mobile phones and computers.

 

What Visually Impaired People Usually Do Online on Their Mobile Phones

In the “2021 China Digital Inclusion User Survey Report” released in 2021, it can be seen that the completely blind group has a very high usage and dependence on smart products.

 

Combining the above two reports, we can see that 99% of completely blind people will use smartphones, and 54% of visually impaired people (91% of whom are blind) will use mobile phones to play games. So, facing the huge gaming needs of the visually impaired group, how to better solve the accessibility settings in the game has become one of the missions of game practitioners.

This article will focus on the gaming experience of the completely blind group, and introduce existing excellent game cases and analyze the methodology in three aspects: the auditory experience of the blind group, the guide design suitable for the blind group, and the game types suitable for the blind group.

1. How Does the Auditory Sense of the Blind Group Experience in Games?

Sound Design

Sound is a very important part for blind players. We can get some clues from the existing few games specially designed for the blind: take the Street Fighter series as an example - every action, move, windup, and recovery will activate corresponding unique sounds.

First, the sounds are sorted and adjusted in a more detailed order of priority.

 

Comparison of Different Sounds Visualized in the Game

Games are not like movies. Movies will mix the sounds according to the process of the film during sound production, so that all sounds maintain the correct proportion. However, the game is completely dynamic, and all actions will change according to the player’s state. If the designer just puts the sound into the game, it must be a disaster.

Here, take FPS games as an example. The real situation is this: when the player shoots, he can hardly hear other sounds; but when the player’s walkie-talkie starts to speak, other sounds will become smaller to ensure that the player can hear his task goals clearly; and when an explosion occurs, other sounds will be covered up… All these arrangements can ensure the player’s pleasure in playing.

 

Therefore, when designing games for blind players, designers need to give priority to different sounds through early design, so that certain sounds “give way” to other sounds when they come out.

Emotional Sound Feedback

For example, in parkour games, the sense of pleasure is the power that constantly supports players to continue playing. At least on the sound level, it is necessary to extend the player’s excitement and freshness, and provide certain positive feedback.

Then a more classic design scheme is to judge the player’s current survival state and survival time through interactive music, and the music is switched and changed in real time to match the current game progress in terms of emotion; at the same time, the sound of a large number of coins or points picked up in the game becomes the pitch that matches the tonality of the background music - that is, the random pitch within the range of the scale where the music is currently located. In this way, when the player runs continuously and eats coins, he will play a melody line that belongs only to the player and does not conflict with the background music; for example, when you eat three coins in a row and trigger three notes, you will be eager to hear the appearance of the next note, and hope that this note will be “developed” and “resolved”.

 

《Subway Surfers》 Coin Sound Effect Schematic

This is completely in line with human psychology, and it also stimulates the player’s motivation to continue playing.

At the same time, the sound feedback during some basic system interface operations needs to rely on the strong logic and rationality of the UI at all levels to support it.

 

Because it is necessary to use sound to establish the UI operation interface, it is more necessary to have a good operation flow. Out of consideration for the blind group, it is also very important to use sound to awaken the user’s curiosity in the functional interface. Currently, the types of sounds commonly used in functional interface operations are: music, sound effects, natural sounds, human voices, and so on. Another point is whether the arrangement of elements in the interface is upward, downward, leftward, or rightward. The position in the interface exists as an interesting variable, and is generally used to express the hierarchical structure between various information elements, and the information transmission and reading order on the screen (accessibility information reading function) between them, which can help developers sort the elements in turn. The more reasonable the design of the interface and process, the more it can empower the gaming experience of the blind group.

In addition, excellent plot can enhance the sense of substitution of the blind group, thereby activating the picture in the heart of the blind group.

Sound can create atmosphere and emotion. Through different sound styles and music, different game scenes and emotions can be created, allowing completely blind players to feel the theme, style, story and other elements of the game.

 

《A Hero’s Journey》 Voiceover Narration

Rich Gesture Sound Feedback

In blind games, gesture commands are a commonly used interaction method, which can allow blind users to control the game through the touch screen, improving the operability and ease of use of the game. To make gesture commands play a better role in blind games, improvements can be made in the following aspects:

  • Design simple, easy-to-remember and intuitive gesture commands, avoiding commands that are too complex or easy to confuse.
  • Provide clear, definite and timely sound feedback so that the blind group knows which command they have executed and what effect it has produced.
  • Consider the different degrees of visual impairment of users and the adaptation problems of different types of devices, and provide multiple choices or custom options.
  • Conduct sufficient and continuous user testing and evaluation, and optimize and improve according to user feedback.

For example, the built-in accessibility service of the iPhone binds rich gesture commands with unique sound feedback to form memory points, so as to better help the blind group to operate.

 

Without exquisite visual animation, and regardless of the design style of flatness and three-dimensionality, the focus of interaction falls on physical gestures. For example, the interactive operations performed by normal people on mobile phones, such as “single click to enter”, “long press and drag”, “slide to switch screens”, etc., are all redefined in the accessibility assistance mode. Blind people no longer need to rely on the physical buttons of the mobile phone to use various program services more deeply.

 

Adding more gesture operations and corresponding sound feedback in the game can help the blind group deepen their memory of operations.

2. Good Guidance

In blind games, the role of good guidance is to help players familiarize themselves with the rules, goals, operations and environment of the game, improve players’ participation and satisfaction, and reduce frustration and abandonment.

Guidance

The Last of Us Part II provides an enhanced listening mode, which enhances the search for high-priority targets and plays corresponding prompt sounds to remind players.

 

《The Last of Us Part II》 Enhanced Listening Mode Schematic

In addition, the way to receive information should also be informed to the blind group in advance: sound can provide navigation and feedback. Through different sound effects and voice prompts, it can help completely blind players understand the game interface, operation methods, target locations, obstacles and other information, as well as the results of their actions and state changes.

 

《The Last of Us Part II》 Enemy Attack Windup Prompt Sound Schematic

Instructions for wearing headphones are also very important, because the blind group will distinguish their operations and the situation they are in according to surround stereo or left and right channels.

 

《A Hero’s Journey》 Headphone Wearing Voice Instructions

Since blind games need to be supplemented by narration or prompt sounds for conventional operations, it is necessary to pay attention to the problem of “speech speed”. People with normal vision usually quickly obtain content and react by receiving visual information, but as a blind group that mainly obtains content through hearing, it is necessary to plan the “functional sound” in the game in advance and open the permission or function to adjust the speed of these sounds.

 

《A Hero’s Journey》 Prompt Sound Speech Speed Adjustment Voice Instructions

Positioning

In blind games, the sound design of positioning is very important, because it can help blind players perceive space and direction, and improve the playability and immersion of the game.

Referenceable solutions include:

  • At different positions, when the distance from the other party increases or decreases, frequency conversion processing is performed on the footsteps.
  • The methodology of echolocation is to use the characteristics of sound wave reflection and attenuation in space to simulate the position of the environment and the enemy. It needs to consider how to design sound sources of different types and intensities, and how to deal with echo effects and reverberation effects; it also needs to consider how to balance the relationship between sound and picture, avoiding audiovisual inconsistency or being too abstract.
  • Encode visual information into sound signals, so that the blind can perceive images through sound.
