In addition, there are many places that reflect this “magical 7”: the number of displays in the status bar and toolbar, the menu items on the UI, the number of key NPCs in the plot… These should basically fall within the range of “7±2”, otherwise, there will be a greater risk of causing players to obtain information and memory burden.

2. Form Information Chunks to Assist User Understanding

Miller’s research is not only on the “number 7”, but also on the concept of chunks and our ability to process memory information.

I believe that everyone will encounter the problem of too many APPs when using mobile phones. Only by classifying them into groups and naming each group correctly can the mobile phone desktop look clean. In fact, this is a daily manifestation of Miller’s Law.

When the amount of information is indeed excessive and cannot be simply and rudely compressed, it is an excellent method to match related information to different information units to form chunks. At this time, the component block replaces a single APP as the memory unit. As long as the number of chunks does not exceed “7±2”, it can easily and effectively help users process and understand information, so that they can quickly identify the content of interest, and “expand” the user’s memory span to a certain extent.

In games, this method has also been widely practiced.

In the UI design of FPS games, the current gun information, the number of bullets, the backup gun, and the throwing object information belong to the same type of elements. They are often grouped together as a whole and displayed at the bottom left or bottom right of the screen at the same time, reducing the burden on the player’s brain: just glance in one direction to get all the relevant information.

 

A large amount of information does not appear individually, but is grouped into “chunks” and regarded as a unit

In addition, the character information (including health, skills, mechanism values, etc.) in ACT games also has the same characteristics, so it is often put together.

Not only the UI, but the backpack systems of many games also reflect this “classification” wisdom. Take the classic sandbox game Minecraft as an example. Its backpack has a one-click sorting function. As long as the player presses the corresponding button, the items will be automatically arranged according to the category; if you want to store, the chest interface also has a classification button with similar functions. After that, when players observe the backpack interface, they are no longer looking around like “headless flies”, but looking for the category first, and then looking for the corresponding item. The difficulty of obtaining information before and after sorting the backpack is very different, which also reflects the importance of chunks in Miller’s Law.

 

The chest classification button of “Minecraft”

3. Present Information Step by Step to Optimize User Experience

Another major method derived from Miller’s Law is: step-by-step design to reduce information density and optimize user experience. In fact, we are practicing the theory of distribution operations every day. Imagine what the user experience would be like if the food delivery APP put ordering, placing an order, filling in the address, and payment on the same interface? What if the mobile bank stuffed the key steps of transfer such as filling in information, obtaining a verification code, and identity confirmation all to the user? Step-by-step design has penetrated into all aspects of our daily life. Although it looks simple, its role cannot be underestimated.

 

Step-by-step design of ordering in food delivery APP

Game operations often encounter scenarios with particularly large amounts of information or complex business. Usually in game design, designers will first sort out the game process, and then process the corresponding information step by step, thereby reducing the impatient emotions brought to players by excessive information content in a single step, allowing players to immerse themselves in the current operation in each step.

The closest thing to step-by-step design in the game is the novice tutorial, because a large amount of information about the operation must be displayed to a person with no experience at all. At this time, how to achieve “clear explanation” while being “easy to understand” and “not discouraging” is the top priority of novice tutorial design.

At present, the novice tutorials of many games have implemented Miller’s Law.

In terms of teaching form, most novice tutorials break down the teaching content into small pieces, and only teach one content at a time, such as operation methods, game rules, task goals, etc., to avoid confusion for new players; in terms of the amount of content, although the types and focus of various game operations are different, the number of key teaching nodes in many novice tutorials falls exactly within the range of “7±2”. This is not a coincidence, but an imperceptible manifestation of Miller’s Law in design.

 

Main teaching points of the novice tutorial of “Destiny 2”

For example, in Destiny 2, although its novice tutorial lasts nearly half an hour, there are actually only a few key teaching points, many of which are already familiar to players (such as movement, jumping, use of firearms, etc.). The information density can be said to be quite low, which also reflects that Destiny 2 is not a very hardcore FPS game. At the same time, the 8 teaching points also fall within the range of Miller’s Law “7±2”, and the overall rhythm and the player’s memory burden have been fully optimized.

And Mount & Blade II: Bannerlord obviously also conforms to this rule: step-by-step teaching, and the number is limited to the range of “7±2”.

 

Main teaching points of the novice tutorial of “Mount & Blade II: Bannerlord”

In addition, inserting plots in the novice tutorial is not only an excellent way to introduce the game world view and explain the background, but also has the effect of reducing information density, allowing users to slowly absorb teaching knowledge and giving players time to remember and digest. This is also why many games like to use the perspective of the protagonist to advance the plot while killing enemies, and embed novice tutorials in the plot.

Of course, not only novice tutorials, but many puzzle game level designs also adopt step-by-step design. At this time, players will no longer advance the level linearly, but obtain information and resources in a step-by-step manner, reflecting the core of puzzle games: information acquisition and information use. And Miller’s Law solves the user experience problem during information acquisition.

For example, in the classic puzzle game Rusty Lake: Paradise, players can see many shadows of step-by-step design. From the perspective of the entire game, its plot process is divided into ten levels (that is, ten disasters), and this division optimizes the user’s plot intake experience; from the perspective of a single level, different information is placed in different small scenes, but the amount of information in each scene is very small, which is also a decrease in information density, which helps to reduce the information collection burden of players, and uses the layout of each small scene to make players form associations.

 

The smallest unit of “Rusty Lake: Paradise”

It can be seen that due to the particularity of puzzle games, the amount of information cannot be controlled within the range of “7±2”, and at this time, step-by-step design is particularly important.

4. Summary

The application of Miller’s Law in design is mainly to solve the user memory problem caused by information blocks. Reasonable information layout and information processing can greatly improve the user’s reading and memory of information. In game design, following Miller’s Law can control the complexity and difficulty of the game, improve the playability and user experience of the game; at the same time, it can also help new players better understand and master the game rules and gameplay.

Game designers can practice Miller’s Law by controlling the number and combination of game rules, interface elements, etc., designing game content step by step, and adopting interactive teaching methods, so as to create a simpler and easier-to-understand game experience, and improve the user satisfaction and reputation of the game. However, Miller’s Law should also be used flexibly, and do not misuse the “magical 7” to make unnecessary restrictions on the design. Analyzing specific situations is the best policy for design.

entry.title: How Can Non-Experts Master the Character Creation System
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

“Ten minutes to start the game, two hours to customize the face.”

This is a widely circulated saying among players in MMORPG games.

In recent years, the character customization system has gradually become a standard feature of role-playing games (RPG), and many players love it. What is the charm of character creation that makes players so obsessed? The Proteus effect mentions that when individuals are given different character traits, they tend to behave in a manner consistent with those traits.

In games with social attributes, this means that when players put on a custom game avatar, they will project their good expectations of themselves onto this avatar, and because of the beautiful appearance of the avatar, their behavior will tend to move closer to the avatar, and they will also tend to be more friendly and enthusiastic in game social interactions.

 

Nowadays, the customization function of game character images is becoming increasingly refined, allowing players to infinitely approach their ideal game image through these highly free customizations.

From the early days when you could only change the face shape, hairstyle, and body shape from a given number of templates, the character creation system has evolved to be able to adjust parameters such as size, position, and rotation through hundreds of fine dimensions. The degree of detail is so great. At the same time, in addition to improving freedom and sophistication to meet the ultimate pursuit of character creation experts, this customization system has also created a threshold for novice character creators.

On the Internet, we mostly hear the voices of “experts” and hear their needs for character creation functions, while the voices of ordinary players are often ignored. To this end, we have summarized the real feedback of ordinary players in different game character creation tests, combined with game examples, and analyzed how to improve the experience of ordinary players in a complex character creation system.

1. Increasingly Powerful Character Creation Systems

The use of game character creation functions is roughly divided into two parts: preset selection and detailed character creation.

In the preset selection, you can choose your favorite style from the given options, directly use this style to enter the game, or enter detailed character creation; in detailed character creation, you can adjust the size, position, orientation, color, brightness and other parameters of each part of the face step by step. It is no exaggeration to say that there are a thousand parameter results for a thousand players, truly achieving the so-called thousand faces for a thousand people.

The detailed character creation of most games is divided into three major sections: shaping, makeup, and hairstyle.

The current facial shaping function can adjust the content that basically covers every muscle of the face. Take Revelation M as an example, there are as many as 36 subdivided modules in the facial shaping part alone, and each module has 4-6 parameter settings. Shaping mostly covers the face shape, eyebrows, eyes, nose, and mouth, and each part is subdivided into multiple sub-parts that can be adjusted. In the adjustment of eyebrows, in addition to large items such as eyebrow shape, eyebrow position on the face, and eyebrow distance, the position of the brow, middle brow, and brow tail are also open for custom adjustment. Moreover, Revelation M also features the addition of ear adjustments, where players can adjust the ear contour, angle, and sharpness.

 

《Revelation M》 Brow Shaping Interface Overview

The makeup system can add more personalized settings to the face on the basis of shaping, maximizing fashion and atmosphere. Makeup generally includes several core sections - eyebrow makeup, eyeliner and eyeshadow, eyelashes, colored contacts, blush, lip gloss, facial accessories, skin tone, or contouring and highlighting for the entire face. Players can customize the style, color, and concentration of the makeup in each part. In more refined games, it is even possible to adjust the local area separately to achieve color clashing and color mixing effects. It can be said that it is a one-to-one reproduction of the freedom of makeup in the real world.

 

《Life Makeover》 Eye Makeup Interface Overview

The complexity of the hairstyle module is obviously much simpler than the previous two. The function of this module is mainly realized through preset styles, and players can choose from a given number of hairstyles to more than ten. In some games with a high degree of freedom, players can customize the length of the hairstyle, the position of the braids, etc., and the hair color can also be adjusted through the full-color gamut color wheel, and even gradient colors can be set. Whether it is a dazzling two-dimensional or ordinary black, brown and gray, you can find your own spectrum.

 

In 《Revelation M》, players can customize the hair color on the RGB color wheel

2. Non-Expert Players Embarrassed by the System

After the above review, everyone will clearly find that although it is just a simple “character creation”, the content covered is very rich. Accompanying such a high degree of freedom is often a high threshold; the more customizable options there are, the more difficult it is for players to find their own direction.

In user research, more than one player has told us: “I will also create the face, but in the end, I use the preset or directly buy the image. I really can’t create it. I can be serious at the beginning, but I get bored later. I feel that what I create is not good-looking, so I might as well buy it.”

Most ordinary players will express it very kindly, “It’s my own problem, I don’t know how to create, for people who are厲害 (lì hai - awesome), high freedom is very good.” But in the actual experience, their feelings of embarrassment and helplessness, and the lack of confidence due to the frustration of character creation, are also real.

In detail, under the high threshold brought by high freedom, ordinary players (or non-expert character creators) may face the following dilemmas when using the custom appearance function.

The first dilemma: The naming of each facial structure in the high-freedom character creation system is too professional, and there is a certain knowledge threshold. In a highly free character creation system, a face can be divided into dozens of components. For example, the facial contour is divided into: forehead, temples, apple cheeks, cheekbones, cheeks, upper jaw, lower jaw, jaw angle, chin, etc., which are all professional names for human facial muscle structure or makeup. Each part also has a variety of adjustment methods. Players who are not familiar with these on a daily basis will inevitably feel confused, “What is this? What is that? They are too similar..

 

Without sufficient character creation experience, players often need to spend more time to check and try one by one to understand which area each block is in charge of. In such a high cognitive load scenario, it is also necessary to spend extra mental effort to try to get started, and the final combination effect may not be satisfactory. The joy of DIY may not be so pure.

The second dilemma: Players lack basic knowledge of facial aesthetics and do not know what kind of operations can achieve the desired temperament and effect. Just like people who don’t pay attention to makeup don’t know how to apply highlights and contour, or how to draw eyeliner and eyeshadow when they first learn makeup to achieve a pure and lovely or cold and domineering temperament. The same is true for novice/entry-level players who are not character creation experts: lack of aesthetic knowledge, it will be difficult to get started.

For example, cuteness generally means that there should be some youthful features on the face, such as a short face, large eyes, a smaller proportion of the upper court, and a relatively full expression of soft tissues; purity requires a certain bluntness of the five senses. If there are more acute angles in the five senses, the feeling of shrewdness is more prominent, and it is not easy to show a pure temperament. Players without this basic knowledge of facial aesthetics will find it difficult to land the temperament they prefer in their hearts on the design (character creation) of specific parts.

 

Facial aesthetic standards of three courts and five eyes

The third dilemma: Ordinary players have insufficient ability to control the overall beauty of the face, and the combination of the parts they create is far from the target face. Based on the experience of looking at faces before, players will have their own preferences for the specific appearance of some facial features, but the overall aesthetic control of the face is relatively vague. When players painstakingly adjust each one for a long time, and finally create the desired oval face, smiling eyes, and sexy lips, they find that although each part is roughly what they want and looks good, the whole face is not coordinated and beautiful enough. At this time, to modify, they will issue painful entanglements of “I don’t know where to start”, “What changes can make the face harmonious and distinctive”, and “Do I still want to enter the game”.

3. “New Needs” of Ordinary Players Under High-Freedom Design

In view of the various difficulties encountered by non-expert players when experiencing the character creation system, many game developers have noticed this and designed a series of solutions to reduce the operational and knowledge barriers, allowing players to enjoy the joy of a thousand faces. When it comes to the specific character creation system settings, the solutions can be divided into the following types of functions.

Type 1: Divide into simple and expert modes, so that players of different expertise levels can find the operating freedom that suits their level.

Generally speaking, the section division in the simple mode is more general, and there will be fewer adjustable parameters, which is suitable for players who pursue the overall effect but do not like to抠细节 (kōu xì jié - fuss over details); the expert mode has a more detailed division and more adjustable parameters, which is suitable for character creation professionals who pursue high precision. Take Life Makeover as an example. In the simple mode, you only need to select the sample and overall parameter adjustment for the face and facial features, while the expert mode can adjust the parameters of each subdivided area of the facial features, including displacement, rotation, and zoom. Players can freely switch between the two modes to meet different application scenarios, which is more flexible.

 

In 《Life Makeover》, eye shaping in simple and expert modes (left is simple, right is expert)

Type 2: Provide a large number of optional templates to help players locate the desired overall effect. Including:

  • Prepare several preset faces, preset eye shapes, eyebrow shapes, lip shapes, etc. Players can create exquisite faces just by combining various templates.

Take New Fantasy Zhu Xian as an example. When entering the character creation system, players can choose from nearly ten preset faces with different facial features and hairstyles. After selecting the preset face, they can also choose from more than a dozen facial styles with different facial features and temperaments. This choice can help players quickly locate the overall effect they want. In Life Makeover, not only are there preset faces for players to choose from, but each facial feature and makeup section also has a large number of preset styles to choose from. Players can even obtain an exquisite face without making any parameter adjustments, just by combining various facial feature styles.

 

Examples of facial styles in 《New Fantasy Zhu Xian》 (left) and examples of facial feature styles in 《Life Makeover》 (right)

  • Random character creation, you can directly choose the one you like the most among a large number of randomly generated appearances.

Take Life Makeover as an example. Players can use the random function to choose from a large number of appearances, and pick the one that surprises them the most among these “blind boxes”. However, the randomly generated results of some games may have uneven quality, and players may need to spend more time if they want to get a satisfactory appearance.

 

Two beautiful appearances (left one and left two) and a weird appearance (right one) randomly generated in 《Life Makeover》

  • Character creation sharing hall or character creation code, players can directly quote popular face templates in the in-game sharing hall, or obtain a sharing code on the external sharing platform for one-click import.

Take Justice Online Mobile as an example. If players do not want to create their own faces, they can also directly enter the “Master Character Creation” sharing hall, where players can choose works that match their aesthetics according to body type and temperament labels, and import them with one click. If you want to copy a high-value face on the external social platform of the game, you can also import it with one click through the character creation sharing code, eliminating the trouble of step-by-step fine-tuning according to the tutorial, which is a lazy person’s happiness code.

 

Master Character Creation in 《Justice Online Mobile》

  • Temperament concept character creation, players can choose the desired temperament effect through the wheel, and the system will automatically adjust the facial structure to present it in a direction that matches the temperament type.

In Justice Online Mobile, players can move between the four temperament dimensions of “immortal”, “childish”, “gentle”, and “fierce” through the temperament wheel. This intuitive change in the concept of temperament can quickly help players determine what kind of face they want. When you want a pure and childish little junior sister face, you only need to drag the wheel to move in the direction of “childish” to roughly achieve it.

 

Temperament Wheel in 《Justice Online Mobile》

Type 3: Set the functions of reset, undo, restore, and save, so that players can “repent” in real time and reduce the cost of trial and error.

The character creation system of the game usually has two basic functions of “undo” and “redo”, allowing players to easily compare each step of the modification before and after. At the same time, some games will also have built-in functions to restore the initial and reset the current part (such as Naraka: Bladepoint), so that players can directly reset a part of the area or the whole with one click when they are not satisfied, and clear and restart at any time. In addition, some games also have the functions of “import” and “export”. For example, in Life Makeover, players can export each step of the operation in real time, and then import and read the file with one click for “repentance” or to restart at any time after interrupting the character creation.

 

Real-time export function in 《Life Makeover》

Type 4: With the assistance of AI technology, help players complete the operation visualization and specific operations from concept to picture, and create the target face they want in one step. Including:

  • Photo character creation

Through photo intelligent character creation, the system can read the pictures of the player himself, celebrities, or even two-dimensional characters, and quickly produce a similar face in a few seconds. For example, in Justice Online Mobile, you only need to upload a photo, and the system can generate a character image with a hairstyle and makeup that matches the photo.

 

Photo character creation function in 《Justice Online Mobile》, both hairstyle and makeup have been adapted

  • Real-time AR expression

In some games equipped with AR scanning, players only need to turn on the camera, and the character’s expression will change in real time according to the player, such as smiling or squinting, and every frown and smile will move with the player.

  • Text character creation

The text character creation function of Justice Online Mobile makes game character creation easier. Players only need to spend a few seconds to enter some adjectives or the names of celebrities. With the support of AI’s black technology, they only need 1 second of cloud computing to turn the fantasy in the player’s mind or the image of their favorite celebrity into real character creation data in the game.

In addition, players can even enter more abstract verses. For example, directly enter “云想衣裳花想容，春风拂槛露华浓” (yún xiǎng yī shang huā xiǎng róng, chūn fēng fú kǎn lù huá nóng), and the player will get the prototype of Yang Guifei. If you really can’t think of descriptive text, there is also a random text function. Click random to generate the corresponding character image according to a large number of verses, truly realizing lazy character creation in one step.

 

Create Yang Guifei’s face in 《Justice Online Mobile》 by entering verses

4. Summary

The character image customization function in RPG games is gradually becoming more and more powerful, but high freedom is often accompanied by high thresholds, which brings a series of experience difficulties to non-expert players:

  • Too many and specialized muscle/makeup names have a certain knowledge threshold;
  • Players lack basic knowledge of facial aesthetics and do not know what kind of operations can achieve the desired temperament effect;
  • Ordinary players have insufficient ability to control the overall beauty of the face, and the combination of the created parts is far from the target face.

In view of the difficulties encountered by non-expert players in the user research conclusions, game developers have taken some measures to reduce the operational and knowledge barriers, so that they can also enjoy the joy of character creation:

  • Divide into simple and expert modes, so that players of different expertise levels can find the operating freedom that suits their level;
  • Provide a large number of optional templates to help players locate the desired overall effect. For example, provide preset faces and preset part styles; random character creation, character creation sharing hall, or character creation code import; temperament concept character creation, etc.
  • Set the functions of reset, undo, restore, and save to reduce the cost of trial and error for players.
  • With the assistance of AI technology, help players complete the visualization and specific operations of concepts into pictures, and create the target face they want in one step. For example, photo character creation, AR expressions, text character creation, etc.

entry.title: Following Intuition Mobile Game Gesture Design to Create Invisible Interactions
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

Most mobile game interactions rely on the UI interface. However, there are some operations that do not rely on the UI, which are pure gesture interactions, namely, moving, zooming, and rotating. In the presence of UI, the player’s behavior path is generally: “See UI control - Generate operation expectation based on the control - Make corresponding operation - Verify through feedback”. However, in the absence of UI cues, players directly generate expectations, and all operations are performed based on the player’s experience and intuition.

Therefore, we can summarize the indicators for evaluating gesture interaction into 3 points:

  • Intuitive: The gesture operations that players try to perform by intuition can help them achieve their goals, and use the most concise operation flow.
  • Predictable: The operation result is controllable and in line with expectations.
  • Feedback: Feedback prompts after the operation are used to prompt the player whether the operation is correct or whether the operation is in place.

This article will introduce these 3 evaluation indicators and elaborate on them with practical development experience and specific application examples.

1. Intuitive Design in Games

The habitual gestures for mobile game players are actually very simple, nothing more than single-finger dragging and double-finger zooming. But in the actual development process, we found that there is still much to learn.

If a Goal Can Be Achieved in One Step, Do Not Divide it into Two Steps

Zooming and dragging correspond to two different operations. But by comparing some common apps, we can find that if the player can drag while zooming, or even rotate, it will be much smoother than zooming first and then dragging, and it is more in line with the player’s expectations. The Android Material Design specification also mentions this. The first figure below shows the scenario where double fingers only support zoom operations. It can be seen that the finger touch points do not match the screen, giving a feeling of lag.

 

Material Design - Demonstrates a Situation Where Multiple Gesture Operations Cannot Be Supported Simultaneously

In the map zoom process of the mobile game Knives Out, we can see that players can determine the axis they want to zoom through two fingers, which can help players confirm the position they want to zoom in one step. However, because they cannot drag while zooming, they cannot drag the position to the visual center, so there is still a slight lag.

 

《Knives Out》 In-Game Map

The reason for this feeling is that when players zoom in on the map to view, they usually have a clear target point. At this time, if the player is required to first zoom based on the center of the screen and then drag, this clear target point will deviate from the player’s visual center, or even go off-screen.

However, in map software, players can use two fingers to complete dragging and moving operations at the same time. Therefore, we can see that if you want to zoom out and push away the “Shidai Elevated Road” in the picture, you only need to perform one operation.

 

Map Software - Zooming and Dragging Can Be Done Simultaneously

In the game Super Animal Royale, players can drag while zooming, making the operation much more intuitive.

 

《Super Animal Royale》 In-Game Map

The Material Design specification also mentions this. In the figure below, the user can simultaneously perform dragging and rotating operations during the two-finger dragging process.

 

Material Design - Two Fingers Can Simultaneously Zoom, Drag, and Rotate

The map system of the iOS photo album function implements this principle. Players can simultaneously complete dragging, zooming, and rotating in one two-finger operation. The operation process is very smooth.

 

iOS Photo Album - Map

When Operations Conflict, Prioritize the Interaction that Players are More Accustomed to and Use More Frequently

Especially in some mobile drawing software, we need to perform single-finger smearing operations on the screen, but the dragging operation that players are most accustomed to is also single-finger. How should we choose when these two operations conflict?

Analyzing the drawing behavior, in this scenario, the most frequently used operation by players is single-finger smearing, while dragging the canvas is only an auxiliary means to better smear, and dragging can be performed simultaneously with two-finger zooming. Therefore, in this case, we can consider letting the single-finger dragging function give way to smearing, and dragging is realized through the offset of two fingers.

 

A Certain Drawing Software

2. Predictable Operation Results

As mentioned earlier, players have psychological expectations when performing gesture operations. This expectation is not only a mapping relationship such as two fingers corresponding to zooming and one finger corresponding to dragging, but also means that players need to be able to accurately and efficiently complete their goals during the operation process. Generally speaking, the sensitivity of the response greatly affects this point. High sensitivity will be relatively more efficient; low sensitivity will be more precise. How do we balance this?

Sensitivity Adjustment: There are Demands for Both “Follow-Hand” and “Not Follow-Hand”

Here, “follow-hand” means that when the player starts a gesture operation, the position where the finger touches the operation object is the same as the position when the operation ends. On the map, it means: when starting to zoom in on the map, the thumb is at point A and the index finger is at point B, and the same is true after zooming in on the map.

Material Design mentions that “follow-hand” interaction is the most intuitive interaction. Comparing the following two figures, the first one is obviously much more comfortable than the second one.

 

Material Design - Follow-Hand Dragging

 

Material Design - Non-Follow-Hand Dragging

We can also see this difference in the operation of common sliding lists.

When dragging slowly, the sliding list is “follow-hand”, which is convenient for users to locate the position they want. When the user swipes quickly, the list is usually swiped quickly, allowing the user to efficiently operate the long list in a short time.

In the first figure below, it is the case of slow dragging, and the movement of the list is “follow-hand”.

 

Douban - Movie List - Slow Dragging

The second one is a quick swipe, especially in this horizontal layout, the content that can be displayed on one screen is limited, and swiping allows users to quickly move the list.

 

Douban - Movie List - Swiping

This sliding operation is very common, for example, in the BP list of Knives Out, “follow-hand” dragging allows players to perform back-and-forth dragging operations.

 

《Knives Out》 BP

There is also an application of a special scenario: the sensitivity is very low, and the movement of the content on the interface will be very slow, behaving as if it is resisting the user’s operation. Usually, this situation will make people feel laggy, but there are also very practical application scenarios:

For example, many applications can enter a new interface or trigger a refresh page after pulling down a certain distance on the home page. This stickiness during dragging can remind the user that there will be different changes on the interface, which is equivalent to a double confirmation, helping the user not to perform unnecessary misoperations. The trigger page on the home page of the shopping app is such an example, the further you slide down, the slower it becomes.

 

Shopping App - Pull Down to Access the Second Floor, Sticky Feel

Summarizing the above, we can get the following rule:

Sensitivity Follow-Hand Application Scenario
Low Yes Used when requiring precise control, such as precise positioning of elements on a map.
Medium Yes/No Common scenario, such as sliding lists. Slow dragging is follow-hand for precise positioning, while fast swiping is not follow-hand for quick browsing.
High No Used for quick operations without precise positioning, such as quickly switching between multiple pages. Also, for cases with low sensitivity acting as drag resistance for secondary confirmation.
Actual development requires constant real-device testing for various gesture sensitivities. For example, single-finger rotation may have subtle differences in feel between games, requiring adjustments based on specific needs, often increasing sensitivity.

For example, in single-finger rotation operations, we found slight feel differences. Sensitivity needs to be adjusted for the demand, and that often means higher sensitivity. The below picture’s rotation would be reasonably fast, even with only a half screen distance.

 

《Harry Potter: Magic Awakened》

3. Give Players Timely Feedback

Giving players feedback during gesture operations can clearly inform the player of the operation status.

Here, I would like to focus on vibration feedback. As a form of expression outside the interface, vibration feedback can not only remind the player of the operation status, but also enhance the sense of immersion. For example, on the Chrome home page, you can trigger 3 functions by swiping down, and you can switch functions by dragging left and right during the sliding process. How do you let the player know that they have dragged in place and can let go? In addition to the water drop-like animation performance on the interface, Chrome also adds a slight vibration prompt to inform the player of this.

 

Chrome Browser Home Page Pulls Down to Switch Between 3 Functions

iPhone has a powerful Taptic Engine, which can define a variety of vibration intensities to meet different usage scenarios. For example, in the game Sky: Children of the Light, players will trigger a weak vibration when clicking on interactive objects, and if the flight energy is insufficient, it will trigger a stronger vibration prompt together with the UI animation.

 

《Sky: Children of the Light》

There is also such vibration feedback in Rayark’s ARPG mobile game Implosion. When the player’s armor is damaged, the mobile phone emits two-stage vibrations, together with screen shaking and special effects for strong prompts.

 

《Implosion》

After the armor is broken, the loss of health is changed to a lighter one-stage vibration, and the screen shaking is also weakened.

 

Unfortunately, many mobile phones do not have such a powerful vibration intensity customization function, and the vibrations are relatively simple, so they are not very suitable for diversified application scenarios, and it is also difficult to provide players with a deeper sense of immersion in touch. Vibration feedback cannot yet be used as a universal form of feedback, and we rarely see its large-scale use in mobile games.

4. Conclusion

The important thing about gesture interaction design is to follow the player’s inner thoughts and give the player feedback on whether the operation is successful or not, giving the player a “sense of certainty” in the absence of a UI interface. A slight deviation between gesture design and intuition will cause a strange feel, so it is not enough to just talk about it on paper. It is necessary to constantly compare and adjust on real devices during the development process to achieve the smoothest gesture interaction.

entry.title: How to Grasp the Needs and Market Characteristics of Middle Eastern Players and Formulate Localization Strategies
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

1. The Necessity of Game Localization

The Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region is one of the most active and growing game markets in the world in recent years. More and more developers are adopting different strategies to localize their video games into Arabic, undoubtedly seeing the huge growth potential here.

The localization of a game, especially in markets with good demand fit, a large player base, and weak English proficiency, can have a huge impact. According to statistics, the sales of Gremlins, Inc. increased eightfold within just three months of the release of the Simplified Chinese version, and it became the best-selling language version of the game, accounting for 31% of total sales.

 

《Gremlins, Inc.》 Official Sales Data for all Regions in the 18 Months After the Game’s Release

Under such market appeal, many production teams will choose to test the waters first and localize part of the game content into Arabic. A more common approach is to start with dubbing, using standard language or dialects for dubbing or subtitles.

However, in the absence of specific research on local player needs and localization expectations, blind action may have the opposite effect.

Ubisoft’s The Division 2 (2019) had a failed dubbing attempt. The game used the Syrian dialect for voice-overs and cutscenes. After Ubisoft released the game trailer, the Arab gaming community expressed dissatisfaction with the Syrian dialect in the game, which forced Ubisoft to change the game language to Modern Standard Arabic. This choice not only cost Ubisoft extra money to re-localize, but also increased the additional time cost.

When deciding to make a localized version, developers will weigh factors such as time, cost, and expectations for the target market. These factors determine the strategy to start the game localization and which game content will be localized into the target language. The currently existing game localization strategies can be divided into four main categories: zero localization, printed materials, partial localization, and full localization.

For example, for some immersive RPG games, especially when the screen contains important interactive elements, it is helpful to partially localize the subtitles for players who do not understand the source language.

 

Arabic Dialogue in 《The Witcher 3》

2. Existing Localization Strategies in the Middle East Market

When it comes to selling games in the target market, video games with zero localization dominate the Arab market because manufacturers believe that Arabic-speaking players who can speak English will buy games in the source language, so they can get some extra sales without investing in the localization process.

For example, Red Dead Redemption 2 (2018) and NBA2K20 (2019), which are popular in the Middle East, the lack of this translation has paved the way for the emergence of Arabic fan localization. Fans in the Middle East translate their favorite games accordingly or provide guides with Arabic commentary or subtitles on YouTube.

 

Red Dead Redemption Arabic Guide on YouTube

In the mid-1990s, packaging and manual localization prevailed in the Arab game market. This part of the localization requires translating a game’s packaging and player’s manual. This level of localization is defined as “market-driven localization”, which also includes the localization of the game’s e-store introduction, website, and installation wizard.

Arabic Packaging and Manual of FIFA 1995

In-game localization strategies also include partial and full localization. Partial localization includes providing translations of in-game text, such as user interface (UI), and subtitles for animations and audio. Full localization involves localizing all game content into the target language, including translating packaging, manuals, and user interfaces, as well as dubbing audio files and illustrations. The following figure counts the number of games (142 in total) that have been localized into Arabic using different strategies between 2005 and 2020.

 

Number of Games Localized into Arabic from 2005 to 2020

Next, let’s take a look at some examples of Arabic products that use various localization strategies and the different effects they bring.

User Interface and Subtitles

The core of partial localization lies in localizing the in-game text and converting the subtitles of voice-overs and cutscenes into the target language. Most companies that want to release games in the Arab region adopt this partial localization. Successful examples include The Witcher 3 (2015), Rise of the Tomb Raider (2016), Resident Evil 7 (2017), Assassin’s Creed: Odyssey (2018), Ghost Recon Breakpoint (2019), and Ghost of Tsushima (2020) - all of which have been well received by Arab players. According to data surveys, about 48% of these games use Modern Standard Arabic (MSA).

 

《Rise of the Tomb Raider》 Arabic Version

However, due to the particularity of Arabic, excessively long subtitles will affect the playability of the game and have a negative impact on the immersion of the game. In this case, instead of enjoying the graphics and gameplay, players may spend more time reading the subtitles. In this regard, including low-quality subtitles may have a negative impact on players’ understanding and overall gaming experience. Due to the lack of experience and historical case studies on Arabic subtitles, there is a lack of reference templates and experience for Arabic subtitles in games, which makes it difficult for game companies and localizers to adjust the game during the actual operation.

The Arabic subtitles in The Witcher 3 (2015) used MSA to localize into Arabic; however, the excessively small font size and long subtitles to fit the screen have adversely affected the intelligibility of the game and the introduction of the entire storyline. Some subtitles in the game contain 8 sentences and strings of more than 200 characters, which is quite lengthy. So, the tenacious Arabic players, in order to continue playing the game, began to make their own comfortable-looking font replacement Mods and shared them on online forums.

 

《The Witcher 3》 Arabic Font Mod

User Interface

Some games only provide localization services for the user interface. This approach only involves minimal localization so that players who do not speak the game’s source language can launch the game and customize the settings according to their preferences. Games that adopt this localization strategy include Goat Simulator (2014) and Squad (2015). Manufacturers may usually adopt this method in order to compress the localization budget and improve the release efficiency, mainly to test the acceptance of the game in specific regions, without investing a lot of money and additional development time in a more in-depth localization process.

There are also some situations where the game code itself does not support providing subtitles for dialogues; the game itself does not rely on dialogues to build the game experience, etc. For example, The Bridge (2013) and Ancestors: The Humankind Odyssey (2019) can both be played smoothly in Arabic at this level of localization. In this case, Arabic players can access all linguistic content (in-game text, such as menus and instructions) in Arabic.

 

《Ancestors: The Humankind Odyssey》 Arabic UI

Subtitles

The practice of localizing only subtitles is not uncommon in the Arab video game market - only providing subtitles for the game’s voice-overs and cutscenes, that is, without localizing the user interface or in-game text. It is often used in games that rely heavily on dialogue, such as Assassin’s Creed (2014, 2015, 2017) and Watch Dogs 2 (2016).

However, in some cases, technical issues in the game code or game engine prevent developers from providing Arabic localization with subtitles. Ubisoft Middle East localization director Malek Teffaha also said: “[Subtitles] are a matter of budget and game engine limitations. In our engine, support for Arabic text direction and fonts is not yet complete.” When designing games, consideration should be given to localizing the interface into other languages; developers should be prepared to handle game code in different languages from the beginning.

Localization is often an aspect that is easily overlooked during the game development process, and the development team may also lack knowledge of certain language characteristics, so they develop a game code whose interface may not fully support them.

For players who do not understand the game’s source language, the ‘subtitles only’ approach is problematic. For example, Watch Dogs 2 lacks localized instructions and in-game ‘tips’. The following figure is taken from the loading screen of Watch Dogs 2. Along the bottom of the screen, the game writes a tip for players: “If you forget how to use something in the game, you can use the Know-It-All app to get some tips and tricks at any time.” However, many Arabic players cannot get useful information through this prompt due to language barriers.

 

《Watch Dogs 2》 (2016) Loading Screen

The upper left corner of the figure below shows instructions on how to play the game (the function of the joystick buttons), explaining how to open the equipment wheel’ or ‘how to sprint’. These actions are crucial to the gameplay, and players who cannot read the source language can only learn these through constant trial and error.

 

《Watch Dogs 2》 (2016) In-game Guidance Screen

3. Conclusion

Between 2005 and 2020, 142 games have been localized into Arabic. Before 2000, localized games were not common. However, with the surge in the number of Arab gamers, major manufacturers have realized the huge potential of this market in the past 15 years and have begun to increase the number of Arabic localized games.

Choosing the level of full localization requires a lot of technical and working time, so the cost is high and time-consuming. Therefore, products usually adopt different levels of localization strategies to find a cost-effective localization route that is suitable for their own product characteristics, skillfully allowing players to understand and smoothly experience the game, thereby opening a window to overseas target users.

entry.title: How to Find the Right Rhythm for Game Updates
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

Game updates are a topic of concern for both developers and players, and a headache for both.

Facing bugs, constantly adjusting operational plans, and the speed at which players consume game content, in addition to normal version scheduling, developers sometimes have to make many updates to the game; while players are actually very conflicted, on the one hand, they hate bugs and expect the game to provide more new modes, new heroes, new skins and other freshness, but when they open the game and face the “update” button that often amounts to several GB and the new version that needs to be adapted to, they feel a little irritable, “I just want to start a game quickly as usual.”

What is a good update frequency? Are AAA games that keep patching responsible or irresponsible to players.

 

Many players have a headache every time they see a game that needs to be updated

1. Are More Frequent Game Updates Better?

Are more frequent game updates better? First of all, let’s get straight to the point: obviously not.

One thing to consider is that players may not be able to keep up with the game’s update rhythm. For example, some MMORPGs make a major update every six months, introducing new levels. In this case, equipment from six months ago may be greatly devalued in six months. The advantage of this update is that it will give many players new motivation to make equipment and give many active players something to do; but for some players, this is a burden, because once they don’t play for a season, or for a new player who has just entered the game, it is difficult for them to catch up with the main group again.

In addition to such major updates, for some games, there may be some additional new content every two weeks. Game developers will attract you to go online within each update cycle and complete various tasks in a relatively short period of time, otherwise you will miss many event/task rewards.

In addition, for some competitive games, too frequent updates will make the player’s learning cost rise sharply. If Naraka: Bladepoint‘s combos are adjusted every month, it will be disastrous for the player’s experience. Because action games are very different from FPS or MOBA, there are combination combos in the game, as well as the combination of various movement techniques, and so on. These things require players to spend a lot of time learning in the training ground, so if we constantly update the habits of combos, then players need to constantly learn new techniques. If the “special skill” that has been practiced after spending a lot of time is just mastered and is weakened or directly unusable, it will only accelerate the loss of players.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》’s new map design took a year

Finally, from the perspective of game developers, launching a new map, hero, or weapon requires a lot of manpower and time costs. For example, players often mention “wanting a new map”, but map design is often the most complex element in the game development process. For example, Naraka: Bladepoint launched a new map on its anniversary, which took about a year; while successful battle royale games like Apex Legends and PUBG also take at least a year to launch a new map.

2. How to Find the Optimal Solution for Update Frequency

If we want to find the potential optimal solution for the update frequency, then we must first understand the several ways of updating the game:

  • Event-based update: DOTA2, etc. This kind of game is often updated with major events as the node. Whether it is a major update or a minor update, it will try to avoid conflicts with the competition.

  • Season update system: Apex Legends, etc. Based on the season, each season will launch new BP, new heroes, and other times are just repairs and patches, without major changes.

  • Short-frequency update: Naraka: Bladepoint, Justice Online, etc. Although these games are also divided into seasons, there will be new content online every 1~2 weeks. Relatively speaking, the frequency is relatively fixed, which is Thursday of a certain week.

  • Completely random update mode: Games like CSGO, the update is completely without any signs. For example, it was recently announced that CS2 would be launched, and there was almost no sign before.

 

《CS2》 is quietly going online

After understanding the update mode, we can come to a rough conclusion: there is no best update rhythm, only the most suitable (for a certain game) update rhythm.

Each of the games mentioned above is an industry benchmark with a leading number of online users, and they have each chosen different update paths. For example, CSGO, this is a game that extremely relies on the muscle memory operation of “recoil control”, so they can’t always make drastic changes. Even when developers want to weaken or strengthen a gun, they do more to balance it by changing the price of the gun, changing the magazine capacity of the gun, and never always changing the trajectory of the gun. Games like Apex Legends that have more elements of Hero Shooters, plus its battle royale elements, is not like traditional shooters. It needs more maps, more heroes and other new elements to give players a sense of freshness and retain players.

 

The hero launched in the new season of 《Apex Legends》

In addition, the unique attributes of games like Apex Legends and DOTA2 make it difficult for the game to achieve perfect balance. Even if “perfect balance” can be achieved in the early stage of the new version release, as time goes by, a super-large online game will eventually evolve more optimal solutions. They all start to adopt the same strategy, such as players choosing fixed heroes and fixed guns, which makes ordinary games or competitions boring, because many of the choices in the game are the same, then the only solution is to release updates to rebalance and change the existing optimal solution.

So, among so many game updates, how should the development team try to find this optimal solution and balance?

If the priority order of version updates is discussed from the perspective of the manufacturer, the first thing to consider is the urgency of the update points, such as major bugs with a large impact range or a deep impact. Let alone being arranged in the planned version update, some games sometimes even decide to use emergency updates to solve such problems; in addition to bugs, obvious experience problems mentioned by a relatively high proportion of players will generally increase in urgency and be placed in the most recent update.

Secondly, the depth of the impact of the problems presented by the game content is a reason for updates that the development team will refer to. For example, if the current consumption speed of game content is much slower or faster than originally planned, and the impact on all players, especially high-active users, is very deep, it is necessary to schedule high-priority updates. For another example, a certain piece of paid equipment does not meet the expectations of many players after it is installed, or its numerical bonus has a strong suppression effect on specific characters in PVP gameplay. Problems like this that have a large negative impact on a certain type of player group, such as paying players/PVP players, should also be adjusted in the most recent update.

Of course, the above mentioned are just examples of factors that affect the update priority and update frequency. In the process of game project operation, there will still be many other modules that need to be considered. The development team should be with users at all times based on the characteristics of their own games, and combine information from the game’s own state, development schedule plan, and player feedback to continuously explore a more suitable update rhythm for themselves.

3. Updates for Single-Player Games

It is not only online games that have update problems, but the patches after the release of single-player games have become a hot topic among game players. In some recent games, many game developers and publishers have released “unfinished” games. For example, Star Wars Jedi: Survivor, which was just released at the end of last month, many players have had the honor of becoming “victims of the genuine game”, because the optimization of this game is really bad, and the player’s comments also reflect this. Many negative reviews are complaining about the optimization of the game, and even the popular IP of Star Wars can’t stop it.

 

Some players think that the optimization of 《Star Wars Jedi: Survivor》 is not good

Of course, this is definitely not an isolated case. The Last of Us, released in March, is a game ported from PS to PC. A game released 10 years ago still has many optimization problems after being ported to PC, and it has been criticized. FORSPOKEN, which was released at the beginning of the year, has been released for 4 months now, and the optimization problem has not been solved yet. The 4090 graphics card will still drop frames and crash wildly in the game.

These are also masterpieces launched by the most well-known game manufacturers, Square Enix, Naughty Dog, and EA’s Respawn Entertainment, all of which are the top developers in the game industry. This makes some players curious, what happened to some AAA games now.

 

Many of the flagship works of major manufacturers are also semi-finished products with poor optimization

The way these big manufacturers solve optimization problems is also simple: patching. This goes back to the topic of “victims of genuine games” mentioned earlier. Some game developers are forced to launch games at a specific time within a limited budget and development time. For some optimization problems of the game, they decide to fix them all later. This seems to be an obvious “scam” in the eyes of some people, and it is difficult to be recognized by players. At least from the perspective of experience, it is very bad. Some players complain that this is equivalent to “paying full price at the beginning for a half-court game.”

Games like Cyberpunk 2077 are also perfect examples. When it was first released, the content was very different from the promotional video, but the developer CDPR slowly filled in some of the content that was originally planned to be launched in the game. Now, although this game has saved a lot of reputation by relying on post-remediation, IP comics, etc., there are still some players who express their views and concerns about this phenomenon in forums and player communities.

 

《Cyberpunk 2077》 is still trying to fix bugs

They will say, “Now there are too many game companies that sell incomplete games to players. Then there are patches on day 1, day 3, day 7… So many patches make the release of new games a death march. Planners and publishers make ridiculous decisions because they choose to fix it after release, ignoring the player experience.”

In fact, the feelings of these players should be understood. Some people have also revealed their hearts: “I hate the idea of regular patching to make up for mistakes, or regular patching for other defects caused by early game launches. Usually this means that the product is problematic, it means a bad player experience, it means it’s an incomplete game.”

4. Summary

In fact, whether it is an online game or a AAA masterpiece, the frequency of updates is a matter of concern and headache for game manufacturers and players. For games of different categories, developers should always take the player’s voice into consideration and formulate the most suitable update rhythm based on their own characteristics. In recent years, some AAA games have collapsed in reputation after their launch, making some fans worried; however, as the impact of the epidemic gradually dissipates, the industry’s capital operations and mergers and acquisitions are more focused on the game products themselves, and the R&D strategies of some developers are more centralized, we believe that the chances of seeing “incomplete games” will become less and less!

entry.title: Making Players Unable to Stop - The Role of the Zeigarnik Effect in Game Design
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

You may have had the following experiences: during an exam, you can clearly remember various key points and details, but after the exam, these details become blurred in your mind; you fill out a quiz in an H5, but are told to forward and share it to see the results; a variety show is about to announce the promotion results, but suddenly a commercial break appears, and you have to wait patiently for the commercial to finish before watching the results.

All of these cases are related to a psychological effect called the “Zeigarnik Effect,” and this theory is also applied to the experience design in the game field. This article will introduce the Zeigarnik Effect and its application examples in the game field, and discuss how designers can use the Zeigarnik Effect to attract players’ attention and make them “unable to stop.”

1. The Zeigarnik Effect and Completion Drive

The Zeigarnik Effect states that humans have a drive to do things from beginning to end, and they have a strong motivation to complete unfinished tasks, and they focus more attention on these unfinished tasks. The reason why people forget completed work is because the motivation to complete it has been satisfied; if the work is not yet completed, the same motivation will make them have a deep impression of it, and their attention will tend to focus on it. Unfinished tasks that are interrupted midway are not only easy to recall, but also have a tendency to continue to be completed after other work has been done.

The reason why many games are addictive can be explained by the Zeigarnik Effect. Take The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild as an example. After the player determines a certain unactivated tower as the main goal, although they will deviate from the route to experience a lot of extra content (such as opening shrines, finding Korok seeds, and clearing enemy strongholds), they will generally continue to move towards the main goal.

When the player sets the destination at the starting point, the desire to complete has already been generated. Before the desire to complete this matter is satisfied, no matter what is done along the way, the player will still retain part of their attention on the main goal. Therefore, the rich exploration content along the way will not affect the basic goal. At the same time, the completion drive supports the player to continue moving forward until they reach the main goal. In this process, the Zeigarnik Effect plays a great role.

 

《The Legend of Zelda》: The content between one starting point and another tower is very rich, but it will not affect the player’s final arrival at the main goal.

Since the Zeigarnik Effect can effectively focus people’s attention on specific events and spontaneously generate a strong completion drive, designers can fully utilize this effect to make players’ intentions more easily aligned with design goals. Next, we will introduce some design methods and points to note that allow the Zeigarnik Effect to work.

2. How Experience Design Utilizes the Zeigarnik Effect to Mobilize Players’ Completion Drive

Visualized Progress Incentive

Providing clear and transparent progress prompts can make players aware of their current completed progress and the remaining amount of tasks to be completed. The certainty brought by this transparent progress information can make players more confident in the task process, thereby having a higher completion drive. There are many ways to express progress information, and visualizing progress information is an efficient and widely used way of conveying information.

For example, in the 3D platform jumping game Super Mario Odyssey, at the beginning of each level, players are told the number of Moons needed to pass the level, and the target number of Moons and the number currently obtained are clearly marked in the HUD.

 

《Super Mario Odyssey》 In-game HUD: How many more Moons the player needs to collect is clearly marked.

In some special situations, clear progress information may play a stronger positive encouraging role. Cuphead is a 2D platform jumping shooting game known for its high difficulty. Its high challenge not only does not discourage a large number of players, but players may even become more frustrated and even addicted in the process of continuous challenge failures, and some design details in the game play a boosting role. For example, the settlement interface where players fail the challenge in the game will display the level position reached in this round, allowing players to clearly see the completed level progress and the remaining level progress. In the boss level, they can also see the boss stage markers that have the same function as milestones, which can effectively encourage players to re-challenge this level; especially when the player is close to the finish line, they will have a stronger completion drive.

The following is the failure interface of Cuphead (the top is the original interface, the bottom is the interface without the level progress bar): Imagine if you see the interface below every time you fail, is it easier to lose your goal and even give up the game.

 

In addition, the expression of progress information can also try to use interesting gameplay for packaging. The Tiny Bang Story is a level-based puzzle game with item finding and collection as the main gameplay. Jigsaw puzzles are a kind of level collection in the game. At the end of each level, players will enter a jigsaw puzzle mini-game interface. Each level can get fragments and complete part of the jigsaw puzzle by themselves. When the jigsaw puzzle is completely completed, the game is cleared. The developer uses the jigsaw puzzle gameplay combined with the game’s worldview to package the game progress in an interesting way. Each completed jigsaw puzzle part corresponds to the level map that has just passed. Players can roughly judge the game progress through the area of the unfinished jigsaw puzzle. This kind of level ending interface that is both ritualistic and interesting can leave a deeper impression.

 

《The Tiny Bang Story》 Jigsaw puzzle gameplay interface after the end of the level. Function buttons are displayed after completing the jigsaw puzzle.

Breaking Down Large Tasks into Small Tasks

To make it easier for players to advance the task flow, large tasks can be broken down into small tasks. This design will reduce the perceived workload of players and make them more likely to put in effort. The character creation process of Biomutant is relatively complicated. If all functions are arranged in the same interface by switching tabs, it may cause certain pressure on players. Therefore, in the game, these pre-settings are divided into several small steps, allowing players to choose to focus on the content of the current page or directly generate it randomly, so that it is not easy to think that these processes are too cumbersome and leave a bad experience impression.

 

《Biomutant》 Character creation process (the picture below is an early real machine demonstration screen, you can see the clear step progress)

The same design can also be seen in the mandatory feature demonstration process of Astro’s Playroom. This process briefly shows players several new features of the controller before players officially enter the game. The designer breaks down all new features into five experience steps so that players can focus on experiencing the current feature in turn, rather than feeling overwhelmed by a bunch of new features and ending the experience hastily.

 

《Astro’s Playroom》 Mandatory feature demonstration process

In Ghost of Tsushima, there is a casual gameplay called Bamboo Strike Challenge. Players need to quickly press the buttons in sequence according to the button sequence instructions on the screen to complete the bamboo cutting. The condition for a successful challenge is that the player quickly presses 7 buttons in sequence. In this challenge task, the player’s completion motivation is very clear, but it is difficult to master the clicking sequence of these seven buttons at once and press them quickly. The player’s completion drive is likely to be suppressed in frustration.

Therefore, the challenge is generally divided into three gradual steps. In the first step, players only need to complete the bamboo cutting of three buttons, which is very simple; the second step adds two button presses on the basis of the first step. Players have basically mastered the method of quickly pressing five buttons here, and have already satisfied the desire to complete the first two steps; the third step is based on the second step. Two more buttons are added on the basis of the step. This step is very challenging, but because of the practice in the first two steps, players will be more likely to master the skills. At the same time, because they are close to completing the goal, the player’s motivation to complete will be stronger, and the possibility of persisting in completing the challenge will be higher.

 

《Ghost of Tsushima》 Bamboo Strike Challenge: Two buttons are added in each step

Artificial Advancement Effect

To better stimulate the player’s completion drive, designers can also try to let players regard the task as “unfinished” rather than “not started”. Here, another psychological term that is often mentioned along with the Zeigarnik Effect is introduced - the Artificial Advancement Effect. The Artificial Advancement Effect is also related to strengthening the drive for action. This theory states that if a person is artificially provided with some progress towards achieving a goal, that person will be more motivated to complete the goal.

A classic example is the car wash membership card experiment. In the experiment, researchers distributed two types of cards with stamps to exchange for free car wash opportunities, but one of them had eight empty stamp spaces, and the other had two stamped spaces and eight empty stamp spaces. Theoretically speaking, both types of cards need to collect 8 more stamps to get a car wash opportunity. But after nine months, 19% of those with the first type of card successfully redeemed the car wash opportunity, while as many as 34% of the latter redeemed the car wash opportunity.

 

In the “Celestial Weaver” appearance extraction interface of Revelation M, players can get a free extraction opportunity every day. We can try to analyze this reward distribution method from the perspective of the Zeigarnik Effect: First, this extraction opportunity breaks the player’s impression of the current cycle of extraction progress as “not started”. Secondly, the progress reward of the prize pool becomes a state of “unfinished”, thereby stimulating the player’s desire and drive to complete the progress reward.

 

《Revelation M》 Appearance prize pool progress bar

Goal Gradient Effect

In addition, the psychological effect closely related to the Zeigarnik Effect is the Goal Gradient Effect. Using the Goal Gradient Effect can also better mobilize the player’s completion drive. The Goal Gradient Effect means that when a person is close to the goal, the drive for action will be stronger. At this time, the manifestation of the enhanced drive for action is to accelerate their own actions in order to reach the goal faster, and to be willing to spend more costs to achieve the goal.

The application of the Goal Gradient Effect on the interface is not uncommon. The more familiar case should be the progress bars of various APPs that are stuck at 99% and difficult to continue. The first 99% is accumulated effortlessly. Compared with the so-called 99% sunk cost, users care more about the last 1% that seems to be within reach. This “fake” progress bar can make users willing to invest more time and effectively enhance users’ willingness to continue waiting.

 

In some games, design details can be seen where designers use progress prompts to enhance players’ drive for action. For example, in the physics-based puzzle game World of Goo, every time the player builds, if they are closer to the end pipe opening, it will trigger a “xx meters left” text feedback. This progress prompt will make the player’s completion drive stronger the closer they get to the pipe opening.

 

《World of Goo》 Distance prompt

There is a similar design in Battlefield 1. The player’s rank promotion is represented by a circular progress bar and an iconized level to express the player’s current level and the progress of this level. In addition, the estimated time cost required for promotion is also specially marked. When the completion cost is within the player’s acceptable range, it is easier to stimulate their completion drive.

 

《Battlefield 1》 Player profile page’s rank promotion column, with the estimated time required for promotion marked below

Positive Feedback

As mentioned earlier, the Zeigarnik Effect achieves the effect of deepening impression and attracting attention through the player’s unfulfilled desire to complete. Although players can obtain a certain amount of mental pleasure through the satisfaction of the desire to complete, designers still need to pay attention to giving players positive feedback at the right time during the task process to avoid leaving an overall negative feeling greater than the positive feeling.

 

《Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2》 The positive feedback when obtaining Battle Pass tokens is very sufficient

3. Summary

In summary, experience design can utilize visualized progress incentives, task decomposition, the Artificial Advancement Effect, the Goal Gradient Effect, and appropriate positive feedback, etc., to make the Zeigarnik Effect play a better role. But no matter what the designer does, it is to guide the player to more easily reach agreement with the design goal and help the player better complete each game goal. The fundamental purpose is always to allow players to have a better gaming experience.

entry.title: Meaning and Rhythm in Games How Poetry Localization Empowers Text
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

For game players or poetry readers, games and poetry are not conventionally compatible art forms.

After all, most poetry expresses serious themes, often involving poets’ reflections on life, death, emotions, and landscapes, or their deepest cries and expressions. Games, on the other hand, seem like a relatively simpler, more direct form of entertainment.

But from an artistic perspective, games are very much like a melting pot. Whether it’s text or images, static or dynamic, once melted into the game, its artistic form becomes multi-dimensional, and its expression becomes diverse.

Therefore, the former, an ancient and solitary art, is revitalized by merging with a new and lively art form.

1. Poetry and Games

Although they are very different fields, in some ways, isn’t writing poetry a kind of word game? Burying meaning, arranging and rhyming, exquisite deliberation, design, and revision, mirrors the process of creating a game.

Similarly, games can be created and expressed in a poetic way.

In 2022, the Royal Festival Hall in London hosted an exhibition by the National Poetry Library called “Poetry Games”. In the exhibition, people could create their own poems through block games. Murray, the organizer of the exhibition, hoped to attract people who are not very fond of entering the poetry library but are familiar with the language of games, to weaken the image of poetry as obscure and difficult to understand in textbooks. People may simply be playing games, and then suddenly burst into inspiration, find that poetry is actually very interesting, and unconsciously write down words. He also mentioned that now all art forms are learning from games, and poetry should do the same.

Indeed, various art forms are already on the road to integration with games.

So when we look at it from the other side, the end of the road, many games themselves are already embedded with rich poetry and poetic language. In Fallout, if the player hacks the terminal of the ghoul Tulip, they can read John Milton’s 17th-century British epic Paradise Lost. In The Elder Scrolls, there are more than 73 poems, songs, and letters, which have even been compiled into a website system for enthusiasts to consult. It can be described as a literary and poetic feast originating from the game.

Similarly, in the game world of Final Fantasy VII, an epic poem called “Loveless” tells the story of three men searching for the legendary “Gift of the Goddess”. This poem has made several cameos in the game’s compilation and was later adapted into a musical stage play. There is also a street named after it in the game.

In addition to directly presenting complete poems, many games have also found other ways to integrate poetry. For example, in the game Wayfinder, players need to control characters to wander in a beautiful world full of poetry, collect fragmented words, and finally compile them into complete fragments to create a poem about the land the protagonist is exploring. Another example is a fantasy adventure game called Elegy for a Dead World, which takes players into landscapes inspired by the poems of Shelley, Keats, and Byron, and then guides them to write directly.

 

《Elegy for a Dead World》

A more direct creation is Ross Sutherland, the producer of Street Fighter II, who released original sonnets based on Street Fighter on National Poetry Day, depicting and creating a new mythical world composed of 12 heroes from Street Fighter.
