Therefore, although niche, cultural art forms such as poetry have quietly infiltrated the game content production process in a quiet and special way.

2. Characteristic Localization of Poetry

If we call the combination of poetry and games a bold fusion, then the localization of poetry in games is like a kind mother who has to tolerate the waywardness of children.

When faced with the expressive desire of poetry in games and its hidden cultural heritage, how to retain the original meaning and emotion of the poem, reflect the rhythm and language style of the poem, and also consider the target language, cultural characteristics, and the acceptance of the audience, is a challenge that every worker in the localization process needs to think deeply about and overcome.

Taking The Elder Scrolls mentioned above as an example, the “Song of the Alchemists” in the game has become an ancient legendary poem widely sung in the game’s story background with its smooth rhythm and simple arrangement. Some clumsy and absurd jokes and names have been specially added to the simple chanting rhythm to highlight how ridiculous it is that a rookie alchemist obtained a potion that made him smart in a pure accident.

Although the English version of the “Song of the Alchemists” uses simple words, the rhythm is interlocking. It starts with end rhyme, interestingly unfolding the beginning of the story:

When King Maraneon’s alchemist had to leave his station

After a laboratory experiment that yielded detonation,

The word went out that the King did want

A new savant

To mix his potions and brews.

But he declared he would only choose

A fellow who knew the tricks and the tools.

The Chinese translation uses words such as “开除 (kāi chú - fired)”, “缘故 (yuán gù - reason)”, and “奴仆 (nú pú - servant)” to retain the pronunciation of “brews” and “choose” in English, completing the end rhyme and promoting the easy-to-sing characteristic of this poem:

国王马兰尼恩的炼金术士被开除

由于他的实验室爆炸了的缘故

国王诏令要新的奴仆

为他配置药水和药物

但他只要一个人

能熟练掌握炼金术的技巧和工具的用途

However, in the more difficult combination of alliteration + end rhyme, Chinese loses some of its color. For example, in English:

After much deliberation, discussions, and debates,

The King picked two well-learned candidates.

The original text has both alliteration of “deliberation, discussions, and debates” and the echo of end rhyme of “debates and candidates”. The Chinese version can only be translated literally:

通过大量的考虑、讨论、辩争

国王最后选了两位有才的候选人

This is related to the characteristics of the language itself. It is indeed difficult for Chinese to achieve both meaning, alliteration, and end rhyme, and to be fluent and rhythmic. However, the use of written language like “通过大量的考虑 (tōng guò dà liàng de kǎo lǜ - through a lot of consideration)” in poetry seems abrupt and awkward. Therefore, from the perspective of whether it conforms to the characteristics of “easy to sing”, “narrative”, “rhythm” and “teasing” of the “Song of the Alchemists” in the game, although this Chinese localized text has some processing that fits the original text, it has not been further scrutinized.

Coincidentally, in the game The Witcher 3, players can also come into contact with many ancient poems, including original poems based on the game’s background story, as well as excellent works from the Middle Ages. For example, the quote from the Ladies of the Wood in the game is taken from the original text of Act 1, Scene 3 of Macbeth:

Sister crones, hand in hand, terrors of the sea and land, thus do go about, about: thrice to thine and thrice to mine, and thrice again, to make up nine.

The original text is precise and powerful, not only in rhythm, but also in syllables and format.

For example, “Sister crones, hand in hand, terrors of the sea and land” is a perfect introductory sentence in terms of format, with both smooth syllable arrangement and rhythmic echo. Moreover, “thrice”, “thine”, “mine” and “nine” appear alternately, making the rhythm of the poem like undulating peaks, giving readers a repeated and enjoyable singing.

Looking at the text alone, players or readers may find it difficult to understand. But in connection with the image of the Ladies of the Wood in the game, the mystery of this text can be broken.

There are three Ladies of the Wood, namely Weavess, Brewess, and Whispess, and their powerful magic comes from the land. For the local residents, they are both gods to rely on and demons that take lives. On the one hand, the Ladies of the Wood reward devout believers who offer sacrifices, eliminate the disasters and difficulties they face, and help the villagers through difficult times; on the other hand, they demand absolute obedience from believers and occasionally require villagers to sacrifice their hair, ears, or even their children.

Moreover, not everyone can see the three ladies: most people can only participate in the dinner at the campfire at the foot of the mountain, and the ladies will select beautiful guests who satisfy them from these people, usually three, and then these young men and women will go up to the mountain to spend the night with them. When these three young men and women come back, they never mention what happened at the night meeting, and even forget their past, just full of joy, as if they were reborn.

 

With the background story of the game in mind, in the existing translations, we can read Zhu Shenghao’s translation of this text:

三姐妹，手牵手，

沧海高山弹指地，朝飞暮返害人命，

姐三巡，妹三巡，三三九转蛊方成。

The Chinese translation also starts with a similar syllable arrangement of “三姐妹，手牵手 (sān jiě mèi, shǒu qiān shǒu - three sisters, hand in hand)”, successfully continuing the jingle-like introduction of the original text. At the same time, the translation also shows the powerful and dialectical abilities of the three sisters: they can both overturn the world and possibly harm people’s lives. In addition to the end rhyme of “地 (dì - land)” and “命 (mìng - life)”, the translation cleverly replaces the “you” and “me” of the original text with “姐三巡，妹三巡 (jiě sān xún, mèi sān xún - sister three rounds, sister three rounds)”, which not only conforms to the meaning of the original text, but also achieves rhyme again and reproduces the poetic and chanting sense.

However, the actual Chinese localization of The Witcher 3 game is much inferior to this translation. The traditional Chinese version of the text not only loses the syllable arrangement, but also makes the poem seem like many unordered dancers running around on the stage due to literal translation and the combination of uncommon sentence patterns. There is no rhythm, no music, and no lighting rehearsal, presenting a strange dance performance:

老巫妪，三姐妹，手牵手，

穿梭海陆，吓破人胆，如此前进，

三次我，三次你，又三次，总共九。

The first sentence “老巫妪，三姐妹 (lǎo wū yù, sān jiě mèi - old crones, three sisters)” is awkward as the opening sentence, and although “手牵手 (shǒu qiān shǒu - hand in hand)” and “总共九 (zǒng gòng jiǔ - nine in total)” have sentence structure and end rhyme, the long sentence in the middle has already fragmented the rhythm. “三次我，三次你 (sān cì wǒ, sān cì nǐ - thrice me, thrice you)” is also a completely literal translation. From the perspective of Chinese, readers simply cannot understand the meaning. Similarly, “总共九 (zǒng gòng jiǔ - nine in total)” is also like an incomplete sentence, which not only does not conform to Chinese sentence habits, but also fails to express any meaning. Even after reading the whole text, it does not help to understand the image and status of the Ladies of the Wood in the game.

3. Text Empowerment and Trade-offs in the Localization of Poetry in Games

The translation and localization of poetry and cultural content in games is crucial to the success and market expansion of games. However, this translation and localization also face many challenges, requiring the knowledge base and in-depth understanding of translators and localization teams. In the process of translation and localization, it is necessary to balance the original meaning and cultural differences, and to consider the acceptance of the readers.

In order to improve the quality and efficiency of poetry translation and localization, professional translation and localization aids can be used, clear standards can be formulated, and cultural experts can be cooperated with for review and testing.

For example, in the localization process of Naraka: Bladepoint, for short but very rhythmic poetry texts, we usually deal with them as English sentences that conform to rhyme and are catchy. For example, the description text of the costume [Spring Snow]:

碎雪浮青叶，风暖春无垠。

(Fragmented snow floats on green leaves, the wind is warm and spring is boundless.)

On the basis of neat Chinese characters and smooth rhythm, English also uses end rhyme to show a beautiful scene of spring and melting snow:

Spring comes with the warm breeze, snow melted then appear the leaves.

However, for some poems and classical Chinese texts that introduce the background story, the primary task of localization is not to rhyme and promote its literary nature, but to be easy to understand and break down cultural barriers.

For example, in the Journey to the West series of appearances, the game quotes the original text of Journey to the West:

混元体正合先天，万劫千番只自然。

(The primordial body is in harmony with nature, and thousands of eons are just natural.)

If too much of the artistic conception that Chinese wants to express is retained here, the translation will become extremely lengthy and lose the original form and meaning of the poem. Therefore, after referring to Anthony C. Yu’s authoritative translation, it is handled here as:

This cosmic being fully fused with nature’s gifts.

Passes with ease through ten thousand toils and tests.

 

After making trade-offs in the expression of the text and shortening the wording, the words “混元 (hùn yuán - primordial)”, “先天 (xiān tiān - innate)”, and “劫 (jié - eon)” with strong cultural imagery in Chinese poetry are stripped of their mystery, eliminating the unnecessary burden of understanding, expressing the original meaning more directly, and ensuring the neatness and brevity of the sentence structure.

4. Conclusion

Cultural differences are a wayward and naughty child in the development of various artistic works. It is wanton, slick, and the barriers it forms often hinder the spread of many excellent works.

Therefore, with the continuous expansion of the game market and the trend of globalization, the localization of poetry in games will become a novel and complex topic. Game developers and localization personnel need to constantly learn and adapt to new technologies and trends to meet the needs of players from different countries and cultural backgrounds, break down cultural barriers, and reduce the difficulty of understanding; at the same time, they also need to continue to pay attention to balancing the original meaning and cultural differences, and consider the acceptance of readers to provide a better gaming experience. In this process, the localization team should work closely together and make joint efforts to become a strong communicator and trailblazer for players in the game world.

entry.title: Exploring Brazilian Esports A Land of Passion with Competitive Genes
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

In the era of rapid development of information technology and globalization, as the influence of games on the economy and society continues to increase, it is also increasingly changing the composition of the culture and entertainment industries. Under this premise, esports has emerged as a new competitive mode, gradually becoming one of the most promising fields in the world from its initial niche status. In the emerging South American game market in recent years, the esports industry in Brazil is particularly prosperous. It has hosted many esports exhibitions and attracted investment and sponsorship from many large European and American manufacturers.

Why is esports so popular in Brazil? What are the characteristics of esports development here? What level have Brazilian professional teams reached in this industry? Let’s explore the answers to these questions.

1. Esports Market and Development Trends

In 2019, among Brazil’s total population of 210 million, there were 75.7 million game players, close to 36% of the total population.

In 2020, Brazil became the country with the fourth largest number of esports viewers in the world, second only to India, China, and the United States. In addition, in Brazil, the recognition that “esports is a sports event” reached 53%, ranking first in the world.

According to a survey by PwC, in 2021, the total revenue of video games and esports in Brazil was approximately US$1.4 billion, surpassing Mexico to become the largest market in Latin America. The survey also showed that this figure is expected to reach US$2.8 billion by 2026, which is double in less than five years, accounting for 47.4% of the total revenue of games and esports in Latin America. According to SiGMA statistics, in esports alone, Brazil’s revenue is expected to reach US$16.03 million in 2023 and maintain a compound annual growth rate of 7.75% by 2027.

In terms of game preferences, Newzoo pointed out that although Brazilian users are closer to North American countries, Brazilians prefer shooting, racing, sports, and strategy mobile games. In addition, games with social attributes are also very popular among Latin American players. Therefore, Brazilian teams are also active in esports events of these game types. Brazilian teams can be seen in many major esports projects such as CS:GO, Rocket League, League of Legends, Valorant, Rainbow Six Siege, Apex Legends, and Super Smash Bros..

In the list of the most discussed esports players in the first half of 2022, Brazilian players occupied three of the top ten. In the top ten list of esports clubs, Brazilian clubs occupied four. In 2022, 4,352 Brazilians received a total of US$47 million in prize money from 3,275 competitions, making the country rank seventh in the world in esports profitability.

2. Sports and Esports

Speaking of sports, when it comes to Brazil, “football” must be the first word that most people think of. In fact, in addition to football, volleyball is also their strength. The Brazilian women’s volleyball team has always been a strong opponent of the Chinese women’s volleyball team. In other sports, Brazilians have also left their mark. Surfing, Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, and racing are all their strengths. Long-term sports experience has also spawned Brazil’s unique competitive culture, making Brazilians highly receptive to esports projects.

Brazilian players like the two-sided competition mode from the bottom of their hearts. Therefore, in this country, esports is also becoming a national sport like football. With no well-known game manufacturers in the country, the Brazilian esports market is still maintaining a healthy development trend. In 2020, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, many traditional sports events were cancelled or suspended, which also allowed esports to develop at a higher speed as an alternative entertainment option.

In MOBA esports projects such as League of Legends and Dota, which require more strategy, Brazilians perform relatively conservatively; while FPS projects, which require more instinct and motor nerves, are the areas where they shine. The glory of the Brazilian team in FPS can be traced back to 2006. At that time, at the World Cyber Games (WCG), Chinese player Sky won the championship of the Warcraft III project for the second time, while the mibr team from Brazil won the championship of the CS 1.6 project, creating a glorious moment for Brazil. Until 2022, Brazil also became the only country to win the biggest championship in the three major mainstream tactical shooting games.

The deep integration of Brazilian esports and traditional sports is also relatively rare in other countries. The fans of both sides highly overlap in identity and are very enthusiastic about participation. The culture of traditional sports is introduced into esports by fans, which is fully reflected in last year’s “CS:GO Rio Major”. Brazilian fans brought jerseys, drums and even fireworks to the closed stadium. The stadium was filled with drums, the uniform cheers of fans and the pervasive smoke, making people feel like they were in a crazy Brazilian football stadium. This Major attracted more than 1.5 million people to watch online at the same time, setting a new record for CS:GO competitions.

The enthusiasm of Brazilian football stars for esports has also encouraged more fans. Brazil’s top star Neymar is an FPS expert. PUBG and CS:GO are his favorite game projects. During the CS:GO Rio Major, the football superstar watched the game of the local team FURIA with his friends at home, and cheered for it on his personal social media. PUBG‘s developer KRAFTON did not miss the opportunity to cooperate with Neymar for marketing. In 2022, Neymar officially became the official publicity ambassador of PUBG, and KRAFTON also focused on expanding in the Americas.

Four Brazilian national team players put on the jerseys of the FURIA team (from left: Casemiro, Neymar, Paquetá, Arthur)

Many football clubs in Brazil are also actively participating in the esports industry. The famous club Flamengo is one of them. The team is very famous in Brazil and has the largest number of fans in Brazil, with about 13 million supporters. Its esports club, Flamengo eSports, won the second season of the 2019 CBLoL (League of Legends Brazilian League). In addition, Neymar’s old club, the famous football club Santos, also established its own Santos esports team in July 2018 after three years of cooperation with Dexterity Team.

Thanks to the high integration of football and esports, Brazilian esports teams are also performing well in the FIFA series. In the “FIFA22 eNations Cup” hosted by EA SPORTS, the Brazilian team defeated the Spanish team, the Italian team, and the defending champion French team in one fell swoop to win the championship.

3. The Unique Favela Esports

Brazil has always been a country with a large slum population. World Bank data shows that in 2016, the slum population of various cities in Brazil accounted for 15% of the total population. Rio de Janeiro alone has nearly 1.5 million people living in slums, more than 20% of the city’s population. And Brazil’s various slums have always been a major source of competitive talent. Football superstars such as Pelé and Ronaldo grew up in slums.

However, for young people in slums, the threshold of esports is much higher than that of football. The high cost of equipment and internet makes it impossible for many young people who are interested in games to participate in this competition.

But at the same time, Brazil’s slums are also undergoing a digital transformation.

In 2019, with the promotion of the Rio esports charity AfroGames, Brazil established the world’s first esports center in a slum. AfroGames personnel once said, “We realized that only children from the middle and upper classes can afford esports activities. In an esports environment dominated by whites and Asians, AfroGames hopes to help change the status quo of our country by creating such a project”.

In addition, there are also esports clubs like Zero Gravity that only sign low-income young people from slums.

Esports events for young people in slums, such as the Favelas Cup and the Favelas Bowl, also provide opportunities for players who need financial support to win prize money.

The Favelas Cup and Favelas Bowl use the tactical competitive mobile game Free Fire as the competition project, and are open to slum players across Brazil. In the 2020 Favelas Cup, the Central Única das Favelas (CUFA) selected 48 participating teams from the slums of 26 states and federal districts in Brazil, 12 of which entered the finals. The total viewing time of the finals live broadcast reached 290,000 hours.

“Our mission is to reach most of Brazil’s poor communities, provide esports competitions, and encourage children and teenagers to enter the world of technology and innovation,” said Tifanny Nayara, the hostess and anchor of the Favelas Cup. According to her, the Favelas Cup reached “about 100 slums, 200 registered teams and a total of 800 players across the country.” With such widespread dissemination, more and more young people in Brazil hope to change their destiny through esports and get the opportunity to get out of the slums.

4. Summary

In Brazil’s strong esports atmosphere, holding esports events has undoubtedly become an important way for Chinese companies going overseas to expand their influence.

Due to the expensive price of consoles and PCs in the local area, it is obvious that ordinary Brazilian players prefer mobile games. Therefore, many manufacturers choose to use mobile game events as an entry point when deploying the Brazilian market, so that products can quickly enter the vision of the majority of ordinary people and even slum players, and use simple and direct publicity models to trigger the popularity of the game.

In fact, in the Discord player community of Naraka: Bladepoint, we often see players’ expectations and discussions about event activities. Even the Naraka: Bladepoint Pro League (NBPL) for mainland China can attract Brazilian KOLs to live broadcast and explain to players through Twitch.

It is foreseeable that if new overseas games in the future, especially mobile games, are released to the Brazilian market, being able to launch independent South American or Brazilian events will definitely trigger greater enthusiasm from players. The Brazilian players’ aggressive style of play in the competition will also make sports and FPS esports events more enjoyable, further attracting a large esports audience and achieving the diversion and promotion of new games.

entry.title: The Appearance and Disappearance of Information - Game Tooltip Design
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

A tooltip is a common graphical user interface element. When a player hovers the mouse over an interface element that needs annotation, a tooltip will appear on the screen to provide supplementary game information.

Its existence not only helps players understand and identify information content, but also helps players process this information more efficiently, or guides players to perform a series of operations—without tooltips providing non-critical or additional information to users, information omission or overload is likely to occur.

1. The Role of Tooltips in Game Interaction

On PC, players use the mouse to interact with various elements in the game on the screen, including the three basic states when interacting with the mouse: normal state, hover state (mouse hover), and active state (mouse click). The tooltip is a very common interaction element in the hover state, used to supplement the relevant information of the element.

Tooltips are an important form and component of game information prompts, and play a role in improving the efficiency of players reading information, guiding and confirming player operations in game interaction. The following will take PC Naraka: Bladepoint as the main case to introduce the role of tooltips in game interaction.

Improve the Efficiency of Players Reading Information

In a game with a more complex mechanism, the information conveyed to users also increases relatively. Therefore, the interactive interface usually uses concise graphics and text as much as possible, so that users can receive an appropriate amount of key information in the game, and more detailed information is presented in the form of tooltips, so as to assist in displaying non-critical information and achieve on-demand and efficient access to information.

Take the interface of selecting existing Souljades in Naraka: Bladepoint as an example. In the Souljade backpack list, the obtained Souljades are arranged horizontally in the form of “icon + Souljade name”. For experienced players, they can directly use this concise information (background quality color, Souljade shape/name) to decide whether to pick up, replace, or discard Souljades, and make the fastest strategic decisions; while novice players can understand what the function of the Souljade is through the tooltip, and the key prompts for related operations, they can also familiarize themselves with the game and extract information and make in-game decisions relatively efficiently.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Souljade Backpack Interface Tooltip

At the same time, because the tooltip is an interactive element of the hover state, it will appear or disappear with the movement of the mouse, rather than being presented in a normal state like key information. Therefore, even if novice players are already familiar with the Souljade mechanism of the game, they will not feel that the information is complex and redundant. In addition, the game also systematically introduces the detailed information of each Souljade in the Souljade interface of the Combat Encyclopedia, which echoes the concise interaction in the game to achieve the unity of game experience playability and information comprehensiveness.

Guide and Confirm Player Operations

One of the functions of tooltips is to guide user operations, and the embodiment in the game is usually key prompts. The key prompt box highlights the key prompt information of shortcut operations to facilitate players to perform quick operations. The figure below shows the key prompt for indicating the number of Bloodrippers to teammates in Naraka: Bladepoint. This is the most typical and concise form of key prompt box, namely key icon and text description.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Tooltip Key Prompt

In the weapon backpack of Naraka: Bladepoint, it also includes the enlarged icon of the weapon and the content of the weapon name. This is more abundant than the tooltip on the left, which is convenient for users to make decisions based on the supplementary information provided in the tooltip; compared with various inconvenient-to-remember information of Souljades, the content of the weapon tooltip is concise, omitting more weapon introduction content. This is because players have common sense understanding of weapons in real life. Whether it is a concise or rich form, this is related to the functionality of the interactive interface.

 

It is worth noting that this type of prompt is usually closely related to the element that is currently in the hover state. The equip/discard shortcut keys in the figure are applicable to all items in the backpack, but in terms of use, they are related to the area where the mouse is hovering. The tooltip here also enlarges the key content and presents it to the player, so that the player can confirm the weapon to be equipped/discarded according to the tooltip, so as to reduce misoperation in game decision-making. Therefore, the tooltip not only provides prompt information for player operations, but also plays a role in information confirmation when players perform related operations.

2. Tooltip Design Principles

The simplest tooltip is often a combination of “function description + shortcut key”, which is characterized by short appearance time, association with marked elements, and short text; in fact, in games, the design of tooltips is very diverse, with different complex forms of graphic and text mixing.

These different forms of tooltips are born to assist the ever-changing game information presentation. But no matter how the form of the prompt changes, their purpose is to: help users understand, identify and process this information. Google has listed the principles of using tooltips in its developed Material Design, as a guide for using its web design tools. Some of the design principles contained therein also have high reference significance for game interaction design. Therefore, we will combine game cases to analyze the design specifications that need to be paid attention to in the design of tooltips, and their corresponding roles in experience design.

Overall Layout Design

In the overall interface that triggers the tooltip state, the tooltip is generally located at the top level of the overall interface, and can cover any interface element in the short appearance time. In order for players to see the information provided by the tooltip, a reasonable position layout is first required.

● Cannot be Truncated

The most basic principle of tooltip layout is that it cannot be truncated. A truncated tooltip will greatly affect the user’s game experience, and may cause key information to be incompletely displayed.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Item Purchase Tooltip (Note: The picture below is a wrong illustration, not a game screenshot)

● Relevance of Position and Control

Because people’s visual habit of reading is from left to right, for tooltips that need to appear on the left and right sides of the corresponding element, they are usually placed on the right side. However, when the space on the right side is not enough to put down the tooltip, or the information in the space on the right side is more important than the left side and cannot be blocked, the tooltip will also be placed on the left side. Because of this, the tooltip areas we can see are often laid out in the middle of the game screen.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Item Tooltip Schematic (Note: Only one tooltip is triggered each time, this picture is a spliced picture)

In addition, some game tooltips appear at the mouse, or at the center point of the selected control. At this time, the association between the tooltip and the selected information is stronger. For example, in the weapon interface of Destiny 2, the tooltip changes in real time with the position of the cursor. While the player’s line of sight moves with the cursor, the tooltip also moves with it. This is also a design in which the tooltip is strongly associated with the position of the cursor.

 

《Destiny 2》 Weapon Interface Tooltip

In Naraka: Bladepoint, the item tooltip appears on both sides of the control in order not to block the icon and other information of the in-game items. Therefore, the position of the tooltip needs to be near the control in the selected state, and the specific position layout needs to be not truncated and not conflict with the game information.

● Horizontal/Vertical Layout is Related to the Interface

The rationality of the layout is also related to the interaction elements. Because it is necessary to associate the tooltip with the hover element, the tooltips in the game screen will be close to the element in the absence of special circumstances, and the content will be highlighted through a more obvious background color.

The specific layout in which orientation of the corresponding element is usually related to other information in the game. For example, the option introduction tooltip in the figure below, as additional information of the vertically arranged list, is drawn out in the horizontal direction.

 

《Marvel’s Spider-Man》 Setting Details Tooltip

Similarly, when presenting horizontal information, the prompt content is laid out on the upper and lower sides; and in order to show the matching object of the tooltip information, sometimes there are designs with arrows or connecting lines.

 

《Yacht Dice》 Guide Tooltip

● Consistent with the Interface Style

In the design of the interactive interface, Marvel’s Spider-Man is mainly based on the dark blue technology style interface to simulate the AR picture seen by the Spider-Man character. In the design of the tooltip, it is also unified with the overall style of the game, and some broken line visual decorations are added to the tooltip to enrich the form, but at the same time, it will not let players be distracted by the decoration and ignore the content.

 

《Marvel’s Spider-Man》 Setting Details Tooltip

Tooltip Content Layout Design

● Text Content is Concise

When the tooltip is pure text content, the text should be as concise as possible to summarize the content that needs to be supplemented, and not to add unnecessary mental activity to the player. For example, in the map of Naraka: Bladepoint, you can see many icons that can be hovered and interacted with, and the function of this landmark is described in a very simple way.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 In-game Map Vendor Tooltip (The left picture is the simplified Chinese version, and the right picture is the German version)

In addition, for the consideration of localization adaptation, concise text can also make the tooltip content of each language within an appropriate length. As shown in the figure above, the tooltip is to keep the width of the tooltips of different languages the same, and the height can be adaptively wrapped and changed with the length of the text, which can not only correctly present each language, but also automatically change when the planner configures different texts.

● Text Hierarchy Presentation Form

In the visual text expression, the text in the tooltip is the same as other text parts, and the hierarchy of text information can be reflected by size, thickness, and color. Allow players to read more text in detail and extract the information they need quickly and use it in the game.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Event Rules Tooltip

In the writing of the text, you can use more short sentences and make good use of paragraphs to create a better reading experience for players. In addition, it should be noted that the level of the tooltip basically appears at the top level and cannot be covered by other interface elements.

● Graphic and Text Mixing Method: Icon + Text

Pictures are more intuitive and faster than words in expressing information. Choosing icons that can express the meaning of words can explain the text more vividly and clearly, and make the page not too boring.

And the image does not need to be localized to be understood by players, so the form of “icon + text” is very suitable for cross-platform global games, which can understand the tooltip content while reading, and associate the text with the image in the brain. In this way, players can quickly associate them together when they see the same icon in different game interfaces, thereby enhancing the game experience.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Hero Interface Skill Tooltip and In-game Skill Icon

Design of Appearance and Disappearance

As mentioned earlier, in PC games, hovering and moving the mouse corresponds to the appearance and disappearance of the tooltip; in mobile games, since there is no hover interaction method, the method of clicking/long pressing to call up the tooltip is adopted; in console games, the interaction of the handle corresponds to the mouse hover state by moving the cursor to select.

● Time Setting for the Appearance and Disappearance of Tooltips

The trigger condition for the appearance of the tooltip is generally set to 0.3-0.5 seconds of mouse hover. This is to ensure that the user’s intention is to view the menu or the content behind the tooltip, rather than moving the mouse to other content or accidentally touching it. Occasionally, it will be triggered after the mouse/cursor is moved to the corresponding control for a long time, as an entrance to the normally closed information prompt.

The trigger for the disappearance of the tooltip is uniformly after moving the mouse/cursor, the control disappears after exceeding 0.5 seconds when it is not selected. Because only when the user clicks or stays outside the target area, or the mouse cursor leaves the target area and exposes the content for more than 0.5 seconds, can it be determined that the player intends to close the tooltip.

● Cannot Trigger Multiple Tooltips at the Same Time

No matter what kind of game device, the appearance and disappearance of the tooltip are temporary, and have a strong match with the single element that the user is interacting with, and there is a basic principle: only a single tooltip can be triggered at the same time. Therefore, in the game, even if the UI elements overlap, the click hot zone of the tooltip still needs to be strictly divided, otherwise multiple tooltips will appear at the same time.

Only by ensuring that at most one tooltip is triggered, the fragmented information will not appear at the same time, so that players have a stronger willingness to read and a higher degree of understanding of the current information, and this focused presentation is also more helpful for players’ information understanding.

 

《Gwent: The Witcher Card Game》 Tooltip: Only One Tooltip Can Be Triggered at a Time

● Simplified Animation Effects

No matter what style, what display, the tooltip content must be clear and recognizable, and you cannot blindly pursue effects, and you cannot put the cart before the horse.

In the case that the interactive interface itself is relatively complex, the appearance and disappearance of the tooltip only needs a simple gradient transition, and even no animation effect design is needed. The main function of the tooltip is information presentation, and too gorgeous animation effects will increase the visual burden of players and hinder the reading of tooltip information.

3. Summary

No matter what form the tooltip appears in, the main function is to present and hide appropriate information to the player in a timely manner. As an important part of the information prompt system, tooltips play a great role in players seeing, understanding, and using game information. Only by designing the most suitable information prompt system for the game can we create the smoothest and most natural experience for players. Therefore, for game designers, from whether to use tooltips, to the selection of tooltip content, form design, etc. are all issues that need to be carefully considered.

entry.title: Skeuomorphism - Creating an Interface Experience with Both Realism and Affinity
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

1. What is Skeuomorphic Design?

Skeuomorphic Design

Skeuomorphism is a form of materializing information, also known as realism. A common method is to simulate the style of real-world objects in the interface, pursuing extreme textures and light and shadow, but it can also imitate the user’s familiar operation methods. By materializing information, it improves the efficiency of people’s information understanding, reduces learning costs, and allows users to become familiar with the interface faster.

In games, a large number of skeuomorphic designs can not only present a more refined interface, but also fully mobilize the player’s sense of intimacy and substitution for the game, and the sense of immersion is even better. Therefore, we can often see the application of skeuomorphic design in games.

 

Flat vs. Skeuomorphic

Characteristics of Skeuomorphic Design

  • More intuitive

By combining information with real objects familiar to players, the presentation of information can be more intuitive and efficient. In Sifu, the game’s worldview and storyline are presented in the form of a collage, allowing players to see the plot at a glance, intuitively view and understand the development of the plot. The whole process is not only in line with the player’s cognition, but also allows players to better substitute into the story presented in front of them, and the information presented in the interface is also very intuitive and clear.

 

《Sifu》 Interface

  • Easy to accept

On an emotional level, skeuomorphic design makes it easier for players to accept and reduces the player’s learning cost. The design of the sign-in page of Onmyoji: The Card Game is presented in the form of a wishing wind chime. The interface is simple and clear, which not only conforms to the player’s cognition, making it easier for players to complete the sign-in process, but also allows players to complete fortune-telling during the sign-in, making it easier to understand and accept, and improving the sign-in rate from a design perspective.

 

《Onmyoji: The Card Game》 Sign-in Page

Risks of Skeuomorphic Design

Skeuomorphic design can create a realistic worldview scene in the game, strengthen the atmosphere of the game by simulating objects, and enhance the player’s psychological and emotional substitution. It can be said that skeuomorphic design is one of the preferred methods for game interface design. However, with the continuous enrichment of game interface information, it is difficult to present a large amount of interface information by simply using skeuomorphic design, and it is also difficult to control the layout and hierarchy of information. To a certain extent, it may put the cart before the horse. If used improperly, a clear interaction path cannot be achieved.

2. Why Use Skeuomorphic Design?

Skeuomorphic design in games is very beneficial to both the game itself and the players, so we often find such designs in games. Specifically, we can explore from two aspects:

Improve the Quality of the Game Interface

On the one hand, for the game itself, the design of the skeuomorphic interface can combine the interface with simulated real elements and carry out artistic processing to form an interface design that meets the psychological needs of players. Through skeuomorphic design, it enhances the efficient matching of game interface information. At the same time, the exquisite and artistic design can also enhance the quality of the interface, easily express the theme of the work, and integrate with the game world.

 

《Ratchet & Clank》 Interface

Situational Interface Enhances Player Immersion

On the other hand, especially for players, the exquisite/realistic skeuomorphic design makes the game interface more situational by effectively connecting reality and the game, and players can also more easily substitute into the current scene and interface. In The Last of Us, the information is connected with the game plot scene, and the map is placed in the player’s audience and scene. This skeuomorphic method is used to enhance the player’s sense of substitution and immersion.

 

《The Last of Us》 Interface

3. How to Make the Interface in the Game More Realistic and Friendly?

Skeuomorphic design can make the game interface more vivid, but if it is not designed properly, it will also lead to low adaptability, interface discordance, inability to present effective information, and other problems. Therefore, in the process of skeuomorphic design, designers should pay attention to:

Skeuomorphic Elements Associated with Reality

The skeuomorphic interface design should simulate object elements that are more in line with the player’s psychological cognition, reduce learning costs, and allow players to naturally integrate into the game. In the interface design of Gran Turismo 7, the game combines the collection of cars with the display form of menus, allowing players to view the collected models by flipping through different menus. Through the element form of the real menu, players are more receptive to the collection of items, and the presentation of the interface is also more vivid.

 

《Gran Turismo 7》 Interface

In the skill page of God of War Ragnarök, the overall interface is designed in the form of stone rubbings, making the overall interface present a heavy effect. Players are like carving on a slate when upgrading skills and equipment, creating a more realistic feeling. In the equipment interface, each weapon has its own exclusive skeuomorphic background. For example, the Blades of Chaos uses the texture of the blade and lava to show the weapon characteristics; while the UI background of the Leviathan Axe shows the frozen attributes. Such a design helps players have a more intuitive and clear understanding of the weapon’s attributes.

 

《God of War Ragnarök》 Interface

Skeuomorphic Design More in Line with the Game Theme

Another key to skeuomorphic design is to make the skeuomorphic elements appearing in the interface conform to the theme of the game itself, so as to strengthen the unity between the interface and the theme and achieve a perfect integration of the interface and the game. Hogwarts Legacy uses the form of magic books and letters in the main interface, combining them with the interface. The yellowish letters and books reflect the mysterious and retro magical colors in the game, and also conform to the background of the times.

 

《Hogwarts Legacy》 Interface

In God of War Ragnarök, a skeuomorphic design that is very consistent with the theme of the game is also selected. In the interface, the form of Atreus’s old books, notebooks, and sketches is used to show the characters, worldview, plot, etc. of the game, which not only fits the theme of the game, but also strengthens the texture and style of the game, rendering the immersive atmosphere of the player’s game. Players are like opening a notepad, reading their own past.

 

《God of War Ragnarök》 Interface

The Sinking City also uses the elements of old and damaged notebooks, which fits the theme of detective games. The yellowish notebook shows various information in the game, allowing players to feel full of suspense and enhance the player’s detective experience.

 

《The Sinking City》 Interface

Full Integration of Interface and Game Scene

The skeuomorphic design in the game needs to fully combine the interface information with the game scene to achieve better unity, and even integrate it into the game, so that players will not be detached from the game world. In Red Dead Redemption 2, the game combines the interface for purchasing items with the scene, allowing players to complete the purchase of items by flipping through the books in the scene, as if they were cowboys in that era, using ancient methods to obtain information about guns, and then selecting and placing orders.

 

《Red Dead Redemption 2》 Purchase Interface

In What Remains of Edith Finch, the interface information is very cleverly combined with the items in the game, and the information prompts are integrated into the scene. The scattering of dandelion text brings a good visual experience to the player. Integrating the interface into the scene cannot appear isolated and abrupt, but should be designed in combination with the current scene, gameplay, etc. of the game, so that this combination is not far-fetched and does not jump out of the scene.

 

《What Remains of Edith Finch》 Interface

Deeper Penetration of Skeuomorphism

One of the goals of skeuomorphism is to allow players to continue their cognition and operation methods in life and reduce learning costs. Therefore, in addition to the external decoration of skeuomorphism, the skeuomorphic design of the player’s operation method is its deeper penetration.

In Ratchet & Clank, the interface is combined with the electronic screen in the game, connecting information with the scene and placing the interface in the game, making the overall scene produce a more three-dimensional sense of space, and the integration with the scene is also more harmonious and unified. Players seem to be clicking on a control screen, and they are also brought into this virtual world.

 

《Ratchet & Clank》 Interface

Dead Space very cleverly integrates the UI with characters and scenes, realizing a deeper exploration of skeuomorphism. The UI interface is completely integrated with the game characters. The character’s health bar in the game can be viewed from the glowing body on the character’s back; while the real-time information of the game is displayed through the character’s hologram in the game. Through the internal UI interface of the scene, the overall game is presented more unified, complete, and real; it also makes the UI, characters, and scenes have a strong connection. Players will not feel detached during the game, and can fully devote themselves to the horror atmosphere.

 

《Dead Space》 Interface

Use Skeuomorphism to Build Page Hierarchy

In skeuomorphic design, if it is not handled properly, it will cause confusion in the page hierarchy or inability to expand interface information. Therefore, in the design, attention should also be paid to using skeuomorphism to build the hierarchical relationship of the page. For example, in Harry Potter: Magic Awakened, cards and notebooks are used to unfold the plot, and the page hierarchy is constructed through the plane relationship, front and back occlusion relationship, color light and shadow of the objects in this skeuomorphic interface, and with the help of book page turning.

 

《Harry Potter: Magic Awakened》

4. Conclusion

The skeuomorphic style in the game world has left a deep impression on us. By simulating things and operation methods familiar to players, it can often allow players to quickly accept the game settings and substitute into the entire atmosphere. Skeuomorphic design not only conforms to various whimsical ideas in the game, but also enhances the player’s immersive experience, so it is widely used in many games. If you lack inspiration in design, you may consider referring to various clues in the real world, carrying out skeuomorphic design, and creating a more realistic and friendly interface!

entry.title: When Games Meet Dopamine Dressing, How to Create Double Happiness
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

If you are a frequent internet user or pay attention to fashion, you should have heard the buzzword “dopamine dressing” recently. In the WeChat index statistics, on a certain day in June alone, the entry for dopamine dressing exceeded 100 million times, with a day-on-day increase of more than 20%.

 

For this seemingly mystifying new term, there are various definitions and descriptions on social media. Generally speaking, fashionable outfits that can effectively improve the wearer’s mood is the so-called “dopamine dressing”, which comes from fashion psychologist Dawnn Karen.

Dopamine is a neurotransmitter that is released by the brain when a person receives pleasure. Most of the dopamine dressing currently popular online also conveys an optimistic and positive concept to people through simple color psychology. Psychologist Karen Pine said in her book “Mind What You Wear: The Psychology of Fashion” that “what we wear greatly affects how we feel, and even changes our thoughts and judgments.” Some scholars call it “enclothed cognition” and found that our outfits can have symbolic meanings that affect psychology and performance. Therefore, whether you want a colorful, sexy or just comfortable look, the most important thing is to wear clothes that make us feel happy.

 

The popularity of dopamine dressing also shows that many people, especially young people, are eager to find their own happiness.

So, in games that also produce a lot of dopamine, what kind of wonderful chemical reaction will the two have?

In fact, in many games, there is such a large group of players with online aesthetics who pay more attention to or like to appreciate the appearance of skins in the game, generally called “appearance-oriented players”; among them, there are also many powerful players who have the hobby of collecting game skins. There are many reasons why they love game skins. On the one hand, the game art caters to their preferences; on the other hand, trying different styles, colors and even skins of different genders in the virtual world can give people a refreshing experience. What attracts them may be to show off their cool fashion special effects, maybe the exaggerated and alternative styles they dare not try in reality, or even the gender-breaking dressing experience.

With the recent popularity of the concept of “dopamine dressing” on social media, people have found that changing clothes and color matching can bring a sense of pleasure, and many players have also shown off their in-game dopamine dressing on social media. Combining the psychological principles of dopamine dressing, we analyze some core points of game dopamine dressing.

1. Dopamine Dressing in Games

Color Matching is a Science

The first principle of dopamine dressing is to trigger positive emotions in oneself and those around them by emphasizing the visual impact brought by colors. The core is to make colors bring people a sense of happiness, comfort and confidence.

In terms of color matching, it is more common to stack skins with similar tones to produce a uniform effect. For example, in Naraka: Bladepoint, players can find multiple pleasures and a sense of belonging through fashion and social interaction by dressing in the same color series as other friends. In these dopamine outfits shared by players, black is mysterious, green is natural and fresh, red is joyful and festive, and blue is cold and quiet.

 

The above Naraka dopamine dressing materials are taken from the sharing of users on the Xiaohongshu platform (MISAKA/F Class Yuan Xiangqin, etc.)

In addition, although contrasting color combinations are risky, they sometimes have surprising visual effects. For example, in the dopamine dressing shared by Justice Online players, the dark-toned male character fashion and the bright-toned female character walking together also create a wonderful sense of contrast.

 

The above Justice Online dressing materials are taken from Bilibili user Huazuo Qingfeng

Background Accessories are the Strongest BUFF

From the examples in the figure above, it is not difficult to notice that in order to achieve a better visual unity effect, not only can the character’s fashion be matched with the same color series as much as possible, but the scene and accessories are also quite particular. For example, in the black fashion, the player chose the background of the dark night roof. The green outfit is matched with mountain waterfalls and green leaf embellishments. In the red outfit, the character holds Spring Festival couplets to add atmosphere. The blue outfit is on the ice and is accompanied by a “cold” expression. In order to enhance the emotional stimulation effect, many users will add a circle of emoticons of corresponding colors or emotions around the characters to make the picture more vivid and lively, and have an atmosphere. This is especially important when players take screenshots or photos to share.

Multiple Dressing Effects are the Traffic Password

This type of video shared by players on social media adopts the common stepping-on-the-beat dressing form of short videos, emphasizing the dynamic effect of the picture, and the picture feeling and emotional stimulation are very direct. With excellent fashion, it is easier to amaze the viewers. Rhythm control is also one of the important elements that determine whether the dopamine dressing video is attractive. Some will match the background music with a strong sense of rhythm to match the picture, and some will use the seven days of the week as the switching node. “One change a day” gives people a stronger sense of substitution.

 

The above Justice Online dressing materials are taken from Bilibili user Dasong Jiepai Zhi

2. “Dopamine Dressing” in Ancient Chinese Art and Ancient Style Games

In fact, as early as in ancient China, there were “dopamine” styles in the Terracotta Army, Tang Sancai, and Tang tomb murals. For example, the Terracotta Army, in fact, their original colors when they were just unearthed were very rich. There were 8 colors in total, including red, green, black, white, blue, purple, yellow, and pink, with nearly 20 shades on different parts of the clothing. These colored pigments came from various minerals or plants in nature, and the color matching was also very bold and avant-garde. There are also a few synthetic materials in the pigments, such as “Chinese purple”, “lead white” and “lead red”, which are considered to be artificially made.

It is understood that scientists first discovered barium copper silicate on Han Dynasty pottery in 1992 and called it “Han purple”. Later, it was found that it was widely used on the Qin Terracotta Army, so it is now generally called “Chinese purple”. The thousands of faces of the Terracotta Army are also vivid and lively due to the “dopamine” color dressing under the careful dressing of ancient craftsmen. Chinese purple is also used by some game art designers to extract design inspiration.

 

The “dopamine dressing” style of the Han Dynasty was based on classical elegance. Hanfu and Han etiquette showed the elegance in the hearts of Chinese people. The main colors of clothing were white, khaki, and brown, embellished with red and pink.

The Tang Dynasty had a broad vision, broad mind and open attitude in terms of political and economic systems, culture and art, and social atmosphere. It absorbed foreign cultures, innovated and developed, and led China into a new era. The Tang Sancai human figurines preserved in many museums in Shaanxi also show the popular “dopamine” dressing at that time.

 

“Clothes are wrapped in clouds and mist, and fairy music saves all beings.” In Naraka: Bladepoint, the image of Longmen Feitian is perfectly restored on the character. The golden璎珞, 帔帛, the drooping clothes, and the color matching of pink, green and red have high recognition and excellent visual presentation effects, which can fully mobilize the positive emotions of players, and at the same time show the traditional Chinese culture, tracing back thousands of years, and presenting history to the world in a new look.

 

3. Conclusion

Whether it is dopamine dressing in reality or fashion matching in games, it is a new way for people to express healthy, positive and optimistic concepts. “Dopamine dressing” may be just one of the many concepts that have quickly become popular with the help of social media, but its diversified expression in various carriers, such as the combination with video games, also gives more people the courage to show their personality and preferences.

entry.title: The Rise of UGC - How Can Grassroots Creators Become Big Trees
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

From the global sweep of Minecraft and Roblox to Fortnite’s UEFN editor becoming a recent hit, the importance of UGC in the gaming field is increasing day by day. Many domestic and foreign game manufacturers have entered the game, either implementing editors in the game or providing level design activities, providing players with a series of level editing tools, allowing players to give full play to their creativity. This form of players being both content consumers and creators may become a major trend in the future development of games.

 

PUBG Mobile launched the creator mode “World of Wonder”, where players can freely build maps/modes

At the same time, according to Epic CEO Tim Sweeney, players spend nearly half of their game time playing in the worlds created in Fortnite Creative, and some creators even earn a lot of income by helping commercial companies build custom worlds in Fortnite. Players’ desire and enthusiasm for UGC content can also be seen.

Among the endless player works, the creative masters among the players have attracted a lot of attention. Many well-known game media or game officials have interviewed them to explore the creative process and design inspiration of these players. There is no doubt that the stories of top creators can inspire developers and motivate onlookers, but they are still not enough for us to understand the entire UGC player ecosystem.

From the KOL pyramid model, ordinary UGC players (mid-tail + long-tail) are a large number of creators. What are the similarities and differences between them and top creators? What is their current situation? What are their demands? There is very little research and discussion at present. We contacted some players of popular UGC games on the market, hoping to provide some clues on how to tap and maintain this group of players with a large base.

 

1. What is the Opportunity for Ordinary UGC Players to Start Creating? What is the Creative Idea?

Strawberry is a college student player who entered Roblox last year, but only started to try the editor this year. “Every time I log in, I will see the popular maps on the homepage. When I play those, I want to replicate a similar map.” Coincidentally, Green Wine, a veteran player of Minecraft, also has similar ideas. “I always see visual feast maps on Bilibili. The color matching is very good. I think it’s amazing. I also want to try to make a map of my own..

 

Visual Feast

Or attracted by the popularity, similar to shooting Douyin/posting on Weibo, they will follow the trend to post popular theme content or bring popular topic tags. Many ordinary UGC players “want to be able to make very popular works themselves, and want more people to like them. This may be the same as the current popular hotspots. No one will like a static model. Everyone wants to try popular things.” Trying to make similar UGC content to ride the trend has become the starting point of their creative path.

In addition, wanting to make maps for friends/partners to check in and play together is also one of the opportunities for some players to start creating. Landscape check-in works are more common. Many players want to use the game editor as a carrier to create a place for themselves and their friends to leave memories/commemorations. “The opportunity to start making maps is to make a commemorative map that can be played with friends, because when I play some maps with novel and beautiful scenery, it is worth checking in, so I want to create a commemorative map in my mind.” Similar to sandbox game players and MMO home players, these UGC creators hope to build homes or internet celebrity scenic spots, pursuing love & peace.

 

Dutch Windmill Village in Minecraft

Some creators also hope to make maps with stronger interaction, or create game levels that can be played together with friends, or make prank maps to see friends’ funny and frustrated reactions. “The opportunity is that I often go to play other people’s maps, so I want to make a map for my partners to play. At first, I wanted to make something for viewing, but if it is only for viewing and has no playability, I will add some gameplay..

 

It is not difficult to see that there are a group of players who have the idea of ​​trying it themselves after seeing beautiful and amazing, or unique and fresh high-heat UGC content on social media. And their creative inspiration, or the idea of ​​starting to create, more or less revolves around one word - replication (imitation), either imitating the works of others, or moving reality into the game.

This is easy to understand. Compared with creating from scratch, replication has a clearer and more visible creative object, and the sense of goal will be relatively stronger, so that it will not be abandoned at the beginning; secondly, the “creation” threshold of replication is low, and the probability of success is high. You can feel the fun of creation and the sense of accomplishment in a short time. Many players can also make micro-innovations on the basis of replication, draw inferences from one another, and the investment cost is relatively low.

In addition, many creative novices enjoy the creative process, similar to the handmade circle. Seeing beautiful and interesting handicrafts (wool felt, cream glue, tufting, etc.), they will also want to follow the tutorial to make it themselves, and feel the fun of handmade DIY. “I started making maps because I thought YEET A PET was very interesting, so I wanted to try to make it myself, and then I slowly figured out some rules of the editor,” said Lemon Tea, a Roblox player.

 

The Popular Roblox Game, “YEET A PET”

This has been increasingly confirmed after asking them about their creative ideas and creative bottlenecks. The creative ideas of these players have obvious commonalities:

  • In terms of gameplay type design, most of them are based on cross-border reference, such as landscape check-in, escape room, haunted house, LARP, and so on. The specific level design is also not innovative from scratch, but draws inspiration from reality (variety shows, film and television dramas, novels, lyrics, etc.) or other games
  • The art style is also mostly following the trend, with real life (buildings/natural scenery and other landscapes, IP images in other fields, etc.) and official season styles being sources of inspiration
  • Or follow the current hot spots, and wait for top creators to research and develop new gameplay/new art styles, and then follow the trend to gradually form a trend

It’s not that their ideas are not creative enough, but that they think it is difficult to materialize the ideas out of thin air. “I have a lot of ideas, but I just can’t make them.” This is mostly limited by the breadth and depth of their use of tools.

For ordinary creators, the introduction and use of UGC tools often “borrow” ideas from top creators. Regarding tool usage skills (how to use advanced tools, how to combine tools, what kind of finished products can be made with XX tools, what functions can improve the efficiency of mapping, etc.), they usually need to provide a problem-solving idea, or have examples to explain the principle of tool use, absorb + use it from practice, so as to draw inferences from one another, and adapt/create new content themselves.

2. What are the Difficulties Faced by Ordinary UGC Players?

Similar to top creators, the motivation for ordinary UGC players to continue creating is mostly the following:

  • [Fun] Creating results with their own hands, experiencing the fun and sense of accomplishment of creation
  • [Recognition] Continuously gaining likes and recognition from the public, and resonating with everyone through their works
  • [Opportunity] Gaining recognition and support from the official, thereby further expanding their influence
  • [Reward] Discovering actual material rewards & income opportunities (such as providing customized services, becoming a social media KOL)
  • [Community belonging] Making new friends during the creative process, often conducting friendly exchanges and discussions, and generating a sense of community belongin.

 

In the process of constantly contacting creators, we also found that, in addition to generating electricity for love, ordinary UGC players are more motivated by the support and encouragement of the audience and fans, as well as the monetization opportunities they seek, to overcome difficulties and improve their creations.

Although the long-lasting incentives of the platform and the occasional stories of popular authors have “tempted” many players to enter the circle, in fact, players have also noticed that “it’s not our turn”, “winning the competition is only because of traffic, there must be gold buried. Like the famous gods now, the popular maps are always made by the same people, and the usual map push traffic is also very poor, no one comes to play, there is really no motivation.” The feeling of pouring out all their enthusiasm makes ordinary creators with a small fan base feel more and more difficult to get ahead.

 

Most UGC games will hold competitions/launch creator support plans, but ordinary players are usually discouraged by the evaluation criteria of traffic

On the one hand, aside from players who only care about the fun of creation, ordinary creators often face the dilemma of entering the game late and finding it difficult to get ahead. Unlike the top creators at the top of the pyramid, they have relied on continuous themes and content innovation, coupled with personal characteristics, and finally have an unshakable position in the subdivided field. However, ordinary creators are limited by the shrinking blue ocean theme field, and they also lack the ability to use tools, and they don’t know where to start to create content with their own characteristics.

On the other hand, game UGC, as a content creation track, most of the UGC content recommendation systems in the game are not much different from the operation ideas of external vertical communities. The platform and top creators have a “symbiotic relationship”, and the platform’s traffic will unconsciously tilt towards the top. First, in terms of commercial realization, top creators are an important bargaining chip for the platform, and the platform will also give top creators more monetization opportunities. Secondly, in terms of user ecology, top creators can help the platform attract new users and stimulate user activity with strong and distinctive content creation, and the platform can be more inclined to top creators in terms of recommendation algorithms. Therefore, in the content ecosystem created by the platform, the status of creators in different circles of the pyramid is very different. The higher you go, the harder it is to break the barriers between circles.

3. Summary

UGC has become a new trend in the development of the game industry. However, in addition to relying on the guidance and drive of top creators, ordinary players are also an indispensable part of this ecology. Therefore, how to bring high-quality, high-potential maps to consumer players, how to make ordinary creators stand out, continuously supplement and support creators, and avoid the phenomenon of monopoly or lack of successors, is a long-term operation problem that UGC game manufacturers urgently need to consider.

entry.title: Immersive, Role-Playing, or Spectating - How Character Involvement Affects Your Purchase of Game Cosmetics
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

In RPG games, you usually play a certain character in the game, and this character brings you into a brand new virtual world.

By taking on this role, you can explore this virtual world, interact with other NPCs, experience various ups and downs, twists and turns of stories and adventures; constantly think about various puzzles in the game, find the best solution, promote the development of the game plot, and obtain various upgrades of the character.

1. Immersion vs Role-Playing vs Spectating

The game protagonist played by the player usually has two typical images, one is immersive, and the other is a blank slate.

Immersive Protagonist (Immersion)

Most of the earliest RPG games had immersive protagonists.

This kind of protagonist has unique character settings and thinking modes, and the game plot will also deeply portray their background stories, character relationships, and personality traits. The protagonist will express their likes and dislikes, opinions, and actively take many actions in various event dialogues. Players cannot change the appearance and name of the protagonist, such as Li Xiaoyao in “Chinese Paladin: Sword and Fairy” and Link in “The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild”. When playing this type of game, the player’s experience is closer to interactive movies and TV.

Another type of immersive protagonist is the character that can be switched into during the game process, such as in “Revelation M”. Players can switch into other characters to explore the map and battle, and these characters also have unique personalities and backgrounds.

Blank Slate Protagonist (Role-Playing vs Spectating)

The biggest feature of this type of character is the lack of personality. The background story line is complete but rarely portrayed; they rarely express opinions in plot dialogues, and even if there are opinions, there are branch options. Many characters do not have voice acting, such as Lumine in “Genshin Impact”. Everyone knows that she is a traveler from a foreign land, but it is difficult to say what kind of person she is.

An American cartoonist, Scott McCloud’s, point is that “the fewer details a character has, the more likely readers are to project themselves into that character.” Many games now allow players to customize the appearance attributes of the protagonist, such as face customization, hair dyeing, and even body customization, but they still cannot provide customized personal plots for all types of “player avatars”. Therefore, blank slate protagonists usually cannot have obvious personality traits.

The original intention of the blank slate protagonist is to allow players to immerse themselves in the game world. But in actual contact with players, we found that among the blank slate protagonists, a large number of players do not immerse themselves in the role, whether it is an MMORPG that emphasizes the experience of the virtual world or an otome game that emphasizes immersion.

For example, in MMORPGs, many male players choose to play female characters, not because they want to experience the plot or battle from the perspective of a female character, but simply because they think the female character is better-looking. In otome games, many female players do not substitute themselves for the protagonist and date the virtual characters, but use the protagonist’s eyes as a camera, go through the plot, and watch the relationships, just like reading a novel or watching a drama.

These types of players can be called spectator-perspective players.

The spectator perspective has no personality characteristics and no character restrictions. The protagonist can be imagined as anyone. For example, adult players will choose to play loli characters and raise them as daughters, while male players playing female characters may project the expected female personality and appearance.

Immersion vs Role-Playing vs Spectating, to put it simply, immersion is to experience the love, hate, and stories of someone else; Role-Playing is to put yourself in the role of the protagonist and personally experience the joys and sorrows of this world; Spectating is to use the perspective of the protagonist as a camera to observe the stories that happen in this world, and the protagonist has little to do with the story itself.

2. Different Ways of Involvement, Completely Different Cosmetic Purchase Decisions

Different game protagonists’ self-involvement methods not only affect the player’s plot experience, but more interestingly, we found that these three involvement methods will have completely different effects on the player’s fashion purchase decisions.

Immersion Brings Added Value to Fashion Themes

Take the two dress-up games “Shining Nikki” and “Life Makeover” as examples:

“Shining Nikki” adopts a typical immersive protagonist. There is a very vivid description of Nikki on the Internet. “Su Nikki, an ordinary person who can’t help staying up late and likes to hum even though she sings out of tune, is enthusiastic to everyone and comes to a strange world. Watching the world collapse in front of her, she constantly tries to save the world several times. Facing the separation from her parents and the betrayal of her friends, she can still be kind and full of vitality.”

“Life Makeover” uses a blank slate protagonist. Players can personalize the name, face, and even height and body shape of the protagonist. As for the protagonist herself, her background story also revolves around her sister. Her sister is a private detective, and there is very little description of the protagonist herself.

The advantage of the blank slate protagonist is that it can meet more diverse needs of substitution or viewing, but it is also difficult to generate empathy due to the lack of character details and distinct personality.

This explains why the Angel and Devil set PV on the first anniversary of “Shining Nikki” became popular and resonated with many old Nikki players, who returned to the game; the main point of popularity was the plot. This set of clothes was given special meaning by the plot, so many people empathized and collected it.

The first six-star limited-time set of “Life Makeover” - Snow Heavy Glory, although there is also a high-quality fashion PV, on social platforms, most people’s attention is only on whether the fashion is beautiful, and few people pay attention to the theme story behind the fashion. For many people, it is just a beautiful six-star appearance.

In game fashion design, the theme is a very important part. Like “Shining Nikki”, the plot can give clothes a special meaning, making many people empathize and collect them, bringing added value to fashion.

In MMO games, the protagonist is usually a blank slate, and the theme value of game fashion is often completed through collaboration, which is the immersive perspective.

For example, the Little Prince and Rose set, which has high sales in “Revelation M”, is based on the classic plot of The Little Prince; when the double ponytail was just launched, many players also began to cosplay Sailor Moon. Recently, the Green Snake set, which is very popular in “Justice Online Mobile”, its interactive action is a restoration of a very classic scene in the movie Green Snake, making players exclaim: It’s so thematic.

In the above two cases, the added value of the theme to fashion is achieved through the immersive perspective.

In MMO games, if the theme is to give fashion special meaning, first of all, this theme must have a three-dimensional/highly recognizable character, and be accompanied by an attractive plot, such as the Little Prince, Green Snake, Fa Hai, etc. Simply giving fashion a theme plot atmosphere without character setting, it is difficult for players to empathize and collect. In addition, it is also necessary to consider the role that players want to substitute, for example, in the theme of Journey to the West, female players will definitely want to substitute the Jade Rabbit, not Sun Wukong.

Fashion Choices for Role-Playing vs Spectating

Players who substitute themselves generally choose the same gender role. When going through the plot or participating in game activities, in order to better substitute into the plot situation, they often dress themselves up and wear fashion that matches the plot to go through the plot. This is more obvious in the Japanese player research. More Japanese players are substituting themselves when playing MMO games. Fashion matching the theme of the expansion pack can attract these players, and they are also more likely to buy fashion because they want to participate in the plot or activities of the expansion pack.

For spectator players, since the character has no obvious personality characteristics under the spectator perspective, players do not substitute themselves, and there are no restrictions on fixed character settings. They can easily imagine the protagonist as anyone, and switch between protagonists of different genders and ages without burden. At the same time, they also have no fixed character choice constraints, and there is no pressure to switch between different styles of characters. This part of the players will have more diverse choices.

At the same time, due to the lack of substitution needs, fashion launched in conjunction with the plot and activities of the expansion pack may not necessarily empower fashion. For these players, choosing beautiful clothes to go through the plot is a higher priority than choosing suitable clothes to go through the plot. They project the personality and appearance of the male/female they expect in their hearts onto the character. Therefore, in terms of fashion choices, they are more inclined to styles that meet their own group or other groups’ expectations and preferences.
